author: {'steamid': '76561198081933947', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1540191783}
review: Начну с того что это копия Age of Empires II, и пускай мне другие люди говорят что это не так. Главное другое, то что игра очень сырая, даже менюшка на главном экране выглядит страшно, а что касается геймплея, то твои войны будут кружиться на одном месте вместо того чтобы пойти в бой, то отряд кавалерии будет стопится об овцу и так и не дойдут до вражеской территории. Самое глупое что я мог увидеть, это когда твой враг бомбит и нажимает alt+f4, и на весь экран появляется надпись:"Ваш противник вышел, ждем его возвращения!". Вы понимаете, что нет смысла ждать и выходите из игры и вам засчитывают поражение. Гениально разработчики! Впрочем, это ужасная копия AoE, тут еще очень много работать и работать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013017981', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 518, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1552518339}
review:
La verdad es que no esperaba mucho de este juego, mas teniendo el Age of empires 2 en steam, pero decidí darle una oportunidad y, esto si bien lo dicen mucho, esta creo que es la primera vez que digo que algo tiene potencial


Lo que tiene Empires Apart que Age of empires 2 no (aparte de ser F2P y tener matchmaking ranked) es que esta enfocado enteramente en el multijugador, por lo tanto las partidas son mas rápidas, un ejemplo de las decisiones que tomaron es eliminar el campamento minero, Campamento madero y la granja a hacer el Almacén, que sirve para juntar todos los 4 materiales sin necesidad de tener que hacer uno de cada uno, y hay otra estructura que se dedica a las mejoras de los aldeanos, y que también sirve como almacén

En vez de avanzar de era en el centro urbano, hay 2 niveles de mejora de la economía y la mejora militar, eso hace que las partidas sean mas rápidas, ya que mientras mejoras la economía o la milicia, vos seguís creando aldeanos

Además de la introducción de Héroes que ayudan en el campo de batalla a lo Warcraft 3 (Bueno, no tanto como en warcraft 3 pero si tiran auras y tienen una habilidad)

Hablando de warcraft 3, este juego tiene ciclo de dia y noche, asi que si queres aprovechar la reducción de vision general de unidades y estructuras, podes usarla para atacar.

Y ademas de todo lo anterior, esta en español

Lo malo es que las demas es civilizaciones son de pago, (a diferencia de age of empires 2) Pero afortunadamente los bizantinos son la civilización principal, por lo tanto una de las mas flexibles en varios sentidos, así que esta lejos de ser "pay to win"



La IA que tiene en modo supervivencia es de lo mas boluda, en vez de destruir todo a su paso se enfocan en el centro urbano, haciendo que puedas joder a la IA sin que te logre tocar, al punto de parecer un tower defense mas que un juego RTS.




Y por ultimo, hay muy pocas personas, 300, mientras que Age of empires 2 siendo de pago tiene 13.000 (cosa llamativa para un juego que tiene mas de 18 años) pero creo que si este juego resive el apoyo que se merece puede sobrevivir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099281974', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1541382835}
review:
Bom,se você é fã de um RTS clássico como AOE,este jogo tem grandes chances de te satisfazer, pois a jogabilidade é bem parecida e cada civilização tem sua peculiariedades.

  Recentemente os desenvolvedores deixaram o jogo gratuito porém,você pode comprar por meio de DLC's civilizações adicionais, é talvez uma forma arriscada de trazer players,mas num escasso mercado pra esse gênero, pra mim foi uma boa idéia.

  Os Bizantinos(civilização custom) é bem equilibrada e com mecânica "simples", o que não fica tão atraz das demais. Em relação as outras, acredito que serão adicionadas posteriormente novas facções,mas cada uma tem uma mecanica unica de se jogar,deixando o jogo bem dinâmico.

  A otimização não esta tão boa,pelo gráfico,alguns computadores relativamente potentes tem uma certa dificuldade de roda-lo.

  Os preços para o Brasil,reconheço estar salgado..mas é algo novo e provavelmente terá promoçoes no futuro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009940041', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1554177029}
review: It's a good Age of Empires clone, but it does have a couple problems such as severe pathing issues with units, and having to buy other nations to unlock them.  It's a small download so if you're cheap and don't want to buy a quality game title, then give this game a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060541682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1540488627}
review:
Die Grafik ist sicherlich geschmackssache - nicht wirklich meins, aber lege ich auch nicht sonderlich wert drauf. Was aber ziemlich stört ist die Steuerung. Habe erstmal mit einem Gefecht gegen die KI angefangen, so nach dem Motto Steuerung sollte die gleiche sein wie in AoE. Also los gings. Linksklick auf den ersten Dorfbewohner. Ping auf der Karte. Bei jedem weitern Linksklick ebenfalls nur die Position gepingt. Naja, weiter rumprobiert und plötzlich ging es ganz normal mit dem auswählen. 
Gut, also doch das Tutorial gespielt. Was soll ich sagen, die Steuerung ist tatsächlich wie in AoE. Nur scheint sie noch rumzubuggen. Wirklich viel wird im Tutorial nicht erklärt, der einzige nennenswerte Unterschied zu seinem Vorbild ist eigentlich das man nicht im Zeitalter vorranschreitet, sondern Militär und Wirtschaftsentwicklungen Oben im Spielbildschirm freischaltet. 
Also ab ins erste 1vs1. Und wieder mit jedem Klick auf Dorfbewohner, Dorfzentrum etc nur gepingt. Wieder ein bisschen durch die Menüs geklickt und es ging wieder. Bugt halt scheinbar noch ein bisschen. Jetzt kommen wir aber zum Hauptproblem des ganzen. Der Server scheint nicht der beste zu sein, zumindest dauert das ausführen von Befehlen ein wenig, was sich vor allem in den Gefechten bemerkbar macht. Das auswählen mehrerer Einheiten auf einmal funktioniert häufig überhaupt nicht. (Der teil wird im knappen Tutorial im Übrigen gar nicht erwähnt) - Und die Einheiten einzeln in den Kampf zu senden ist so gut wie unmöglich. Wenn der Server gerade eine gute Minute hat geht es dann aber doch ganz gut. 

Ohne diese beiden Probleme würde das Spiel sicherlich sogar spaß machen. Vielleicht hatte ich auch nur einen schlechten Moment erwischt. Aber auch ohne diese wäre eines der Spiele aus der AoE- Reihe sicherlich die bessere wahl. Nur eine freie Nation ist etwas mager. Zwei oder drei sollten es schon sein, sonst Spielt man selbst auch immer nur gegen die gleiche Nation. Außerdem gibt es lediglich 1vs1-Schlachten. Oder halt die gegen die KI. Eine Singleplayerkampagne fehlt vollkommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095807918', 'num_games_owned': 1376, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1540147236}
review:

Not:oyun çok iyi değil ama grafikleri çok güzel keşke f2p olarak sadece tek devlet oynanabiliyor olmasaymış onun yerine oyunu direkt paralı yapsalarmış veya bu demosu olsaymış tek tek devlet almak çok iyi bir sistem değil sonra başka devlet getirecekler onları al onları al bir bakmışsın aylık abonelik sistemlerine dönmüş

author: {'steamid': '76561198290144620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 286, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1540125874}
review:
制作组是不是唱衰《帝国时代4》？居然出了个和《帝国时代1》《帝国时代2》内容非常雷同的3D游戏，要采集的资源都一样，科技树也差不多。

游戏画面看起来简陋，掉帧却非常严重。

AI寻路糟糕，有时候电脑的士兵单位都不出击，就等着拆家。

地图面积小又要排阵型，真的麻烦。

单位动作都不连贯，非常生硬。

大面积框选不会过滤掉非战斗单位。

农民种田要重新播种还要专门勾选。

韩国文明有火枪，这是怎么划分时代的？怎么不让其它文明上飞机大炮？

游戏一开始好像是40-50一份完整版，然后免费游玩，现在又拆成一个个文明卖DLC，想钱想疯了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198076615380', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1540991947}
review:
Having been someone who had taken notice of this game, and had passed over it initally due to the lack of a single player campaign, I decided to try it out when it went free to play. 
What I found was a very promising RTS that sought to take what Age of Empires II did well, and improve on what it did poorly in. From what I've played, I have found the game to have minimal bugs, and decent pathfinding, and my experience with the Byzantines has been great fun. I would best describe this game as Age of Empires II crossed with Warcraft III; it has taken the fun gameplay of Age of Empires II and has greater faction diversity that makes up for some of Age of Empires II limitations, such as a lack of unique building sets for each faction and each faction playing the same. 
However, I do think the game is lacking in some areas. Firstly, I think the lack of a map editor is a real drawback, and the lack of map scripts is general is worrying for the long term. The big thing however is a lack of singleplayer modes. While there is a perfect capable skimish mode with a functional AI, I do think the lack of campaigns is sad. I think a few campaigns would add a lot of fun. 
That being said, I do feel the limitations do not make it a bad game, and so I can still recommend it in good faith. In short, if you are looking for an Age of Empires II: 3D, this game may not be for you, but if you are looking for a game that attempts to build on it, I do think its worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121574961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1540080293}
review:
Isso é uma opinião MINHA quanto ao jogo. Se você não gostou apenas não comente besteiras e jogue o game pra ver se te agrada. 

Gosto é igual c** cada um tem o seu.

[h1]Simplesmente...Horrível...[/h1]

Descontentíssima quanto a esse jogo 1/10

Acho que nunca me senti tão frustrada quanto a um game em 24 anos. (tirando a DLC do AOM china que foi uma B.O.S.T.A malfeita)

O que mais me irritou:

1 - Se você não paga uma DLC você não consegue jogar. PAY TO WIN
2 - Morta por unidades montadas(cavaleiros) em menos de 5 min? WHAT!? Eu fui obliterada por 5 cavalos sendo que eu tinha um exercito de lanceiros e eles tem >>BONUS CONTRA CAVALARIA<<... QUE?!
3 - Jogadores tóxicos...MIMIMI
4 - Eu conheço esse "vulomé"....
5 - TOTALMENTE DESLABANCEADO! O que é isso? O que é isso? Quando você ver, PÁ. "ELIMINADO" Vamos arrumar esse balanceamento desenvolvedores! As DLC's pagas tem MUITO, MAS MUITO poder militar sob a >>CUSTOM<< que vem pra você.

Tentaram lançar um age of empires misturado com os sons do age of mitology em uma textura low poly e que trava pra caramba!

[h1]Config do meu pc:[/h1]

[b]Placa de vídeo GTX 1050 Ti 4GB
Processador Pentium G4560
Memória ram 8 GB (2 pentes de 4) 2400MHZ
Windows 8.1[/b]

Tecnicamente não é pra travar né :V

Totalmente descontente. Vou desinstalar da biblioteca e voltar ao AOE e o AOM mesmo.

[h1][b]Não recomendo. Instale por conta e risco[/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198843124456', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1539993327}
review:
Very mundane AOE ripoff (attempt anyway). janky, very clunky controls and the bugs are pretty expansive throughout. Went free to play after charging others 30$ from what I see/read of it's history. Netcode is pretty lax and unstable. They then cut the game up into DLC pieces to retain their prioce gouging (Of which the publisher Slitherine is widely known for, just examine their catalog). You're left with 1 civ and very little content unless you pay up.  (Free is never free ya know 99% of the time). One can find many many games in this genre, affordable, especially on sale, that are very worth it, this is not. 

Likewise this publisher (and this developer) are quite intense with forum censorship/abuse, granted Valve makes this possible with it's very wide general "rules" so you will find many who do it and other devs/publishers who do not. This one seems to enjoy it greatly....it goes like this...LOL
Player 1 : this game is pretty bad
Mod/Dev : No It's not
Player 1 : yeah I think it is
Mod?dev : You have a permanant ban , reason, arguing with moderator/dev.

Believe it or not that is totally ok with Valve and support would do NOTHING for you. This one takes full advantage of it, a critical comment is an "Attack" and "Rude" or whatever their perspective claims.

Again, this game was pretty much unsatisfying drudgery, mundane graphics and an overall umpolished "cheap" feel and presentation and you'd do yourself a big favor by seeking out good games of this genre on sale. All the negs are not wrong by any means. Unless of course you like fooling yourself that you got a free game while paying out for pretty much any content beyond a glorified demo of a very mediocre game. It did not go from 30$ to "free to play" for nothing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074274135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1529, 'last_played': 1541294901}
review: It has its glitches, but to be fair it’s a very new game. It just arrived out of beta, so these negative reviews aren’t really fair. The game developers are active and sending out patches/content, it’s not like Ark or other games where you buy it and then find out the GD had given up on the game. The developers spend a lot of time in the discord helping players and taking advice so I do love that about the game. I think this game has a ton of potential. For that reason I plan to stick to it, even though it’s full of glitches and issues; because the developers are clearly still working on it. They even made it free, which I think should be a huge reminder their not in it for the money. Anyways, keep up the good work guys, EA has a ton of potential! Don’t lose it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054780409', 'num_games_owned': 1814, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1541344148}
review:
[h1]Своя империя, свой стиль.[/h1]

Так-так, кто это у нас перешел на фтп модель [strike]стоим больше чем раньше [/strike], а так это же  [strike]AoE[/strike],  Empires Apart.

Начнем, пожалуй, с выбора режима игры. Ой, стоп, где кнопка кампании? А, что? Ее нет? Ну ладно, не больно уж и хотелось. Хотя в захват региона, как в Rise of Nations я бы поиграл. Зато есть режим Выживания, но он представлен пока одной картой, что есть печально. Может в будущем…Так, что тут у нас режим Испытания, не плохо, люблю такое. По 8 испытаний на империю, можно было бы и больше. Ну и остаётся у нас стандартный режим скирмиша. Для мультиплеера предусмотрены рейтинговые и обычные игры. Так вот в какую сторону разрабы смотрели…

Выбираем количество врагов, устанавливаем условия победы, запускаем режим одиночной битвы. Перед нами ни что иное как классическая РТС. Как обычно начинаем с рабочего центра, где наштампованных работников  сразу раскидываем на добычу ресурсов: дерева, еды, золота, камня. Все ресурсы в той или иной мере нужны приобретения юнитов и проведения исследований. Дерево и еда являются ключевыми, как для найма юнитов, так и проведения исследований, тогда как камень используется в основном только для защитных сооружений: башен, стен, крепостей. Золото уходит на покупку некоторых юнитов и проведения поздних апгрейдов оных.

Юниты в игре как я уже упоминал разнятся в зависимости от фракции. На месте все, как от обычного мечника, так и до осадных таранов и катапульт. Но есть в игре еще и герои. Как и все в игре они тоже разделены  на две специальности, один боец, активно участвующий в баталиях, другой будет поднимать вашу экономику с колен.
Еще стоит упомянуть, что развитие и сам процесс геймплея значительнее быстрей, чем в той же AoE и финиш развития наступает раньше, как собственно и конец битвы. 

Что касается фракций. Всего в игре их семь. Каждая из представленных в игре империй имеет собственные пути развития: технологии, постройки, юниты. Для каждой из фракции разработаны уникальные механики. Игра радикально меняется каждый раз, когда вы выбираете другую расу. Например, монголы, как истинно кочевое племя, не любят засиживаться на одном месте. Играя за Орду, вы всегда может разобрать возведенное здание и перевезти его на другое место, даже изменив его назначение. Воины ацтеков за бои получают опыт и сами улучшаются, без проведения исследований.

Исследования. Здесь игр пошла по пути тотального упрощения. Перехода в новые эры путем изучения определённого количества более мелких технологий или возведения требуемого количества зданий нет. У нас есть два пути развития: экономический и военный. Изучить их можно сразу же, набрав требуемые количество ресурсов. Пути имеют 2 уровня развития и открывают новые здания и юниты. Открыв и построив гончарную мастерскую, вы получите пачку исследований для крестьян по сбору ресов, военный путь естественно откроет кузницу с улучшений для боевой силы. Есть еще университет с различных исследований, такими к примеру, как ХП стен и прочее.


Графика в игре специфичная, простая, во время игровой ночи немного напряжено смотреть на экран. Музыкальная часть выполнена достаточно хорошо.

Есть еще некоторые вопросы к АИ, иногда он любит потупить.Как пример вступить в неравную схватку с твоими стенами(хотя есть уже огромные дыры в защитных сооружениях), пока ты будешь уничтожать его юнит за юнитом и реагировать на это с запозданием. Позитив есть, разработчики все же выпускают патчи по его улучшению.

Но все же, как итог, игра весьма даже ничего. Однако отсутствие одиночной кампании и порой странное поведение ИИ может отпугнуть. Учитывая, что игра стала относительно бесплатной попробовать ее можно и даже нужно. Авось зайдет. Лично я обязательно докуплю себе DLC с империями…на скидках. Кстати о сравнении с AoE, мне почему-то игра больше напомнила своим поведением Age of Mythology.

P.S
Ах, да ограничения бесплатной версии. Для игры доступная только одна империя – Византия.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106307169', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1606956730}
review:
Honestly not too sure why this game has so many negative reviews now that it is free, so i will be honest the fact you can only have one faction with the free version is a bit of a kicker but concidering it is free you really can't complain about these sort of things. I do believe they should add some kind of "All Factions" Pack so you do not have to buy them individually , then people who enjoyed the free "trial" faction could get the full experiance. 

As of right now the vs. AI seems to be bugged in multiplayer and you get stuck in a desync loop but the solution is just to grab some friends and play a 2v2 ( Just tell them it is free) had a tun of fun so far and i will deffinately be getting some other friends to check it out too so we can do some larger scale games.

Side note:
A lot of the reviews for this game refer to it as a aoe2 clone and to some extent this is true but the game is distinct enough to have its own feel and if you are burned out on aoe games then this game is different enough to make it feel fresh , give it a go and for goodness sake please do not let this "Mixed Reviews" put you off trying a FREE game. ^-^

looking forward to seeing updates and i really hope the developers add new factions/game modes as time goes on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194801761', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1539946978}
review:
Awful develper and below effort game. Low end graphics and a very poor Empire Earth, AOE, AOW knock off. CDOntrols are awful and the bugs are, and continue to be, frustrating and not worth the time or effort when there's so many other games you can turn to for this kind of gameplay. The Dev itself has also proven to be quite hostile towards critics, banning at will for just negative feedback (not attacks, insults, fights or flaming  players) but juust plain olf negatiuve feedback without any hostile intent or behavior. Add to that they took it f2p and gvae players 1 race and made everything else a paid DLC....wow, failed both  public relations AND business 101 classes I think.

So not only was the game poorly made and recieved, but the dev has decided to take out his frustration with forum trolling, bannings, and a hostile atmosphere. You CAN find so many games of the same genre, even if they aren't free, that are worth both your support and time. This is not one of them.  If you are into this kind of gameplay, you ind a nice selection on Steam that is worth supporting, many for a very low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188989678', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1539944780}
review:
Went f2p and left previous players with 1 race, made all others paid DLC. Very poor imitation of Age Of Empires type games. Very medicore grqphics, badly executed controls, and riddled, and I mean riddled with bugs and sloppy code, netcode especially. There are so many games of this genre that, even not free, are very low priced and well made. Even free this is a horrible deriviative knock-off.

As to the developer,  bans anyone critizing the descisions. Forum censoring and abusivebehavor towards players. There are other developers who deserve your money and time. Don't reward such behavior with DLC purchases when there are so many other, easy to find, better options for your gaming time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027186712', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1561918608}
review:
[h1]A decent attempt to make an old school RTS[/h1]
But it just doesn't feel right... Its a lot smoother than the initial paid version, but the game still uses unbelievable amounts of computer resources. Most skirmishes I just quit because they don't feel rewarding to finish, honestly, how do you get bored in the middle of a game like this? They just didn't deliver what anyone wanted, that's simply put and that's it.

The good:
[list]
[*]Not the worst attempt at an RTS, but it really didnt bring anything new to the genre and still hasn't since they switched to F2P
[*]Really nice graphics and details as a polygon art style game
[*]The age up between economy and military upgrades is a nice fresh take
[*]Has potential
[/list]

The bad:
[list]
[*]Those of you coming for the free to play element, you get one civ, and have to pay $5 EACH for the rest, and ill be honest, after a few skirmishes with the AI, there is no incentive to keep playing, you don't progress? you just play a new game every time, so just play age of empires 2 instead...
[*]The game is nothing like they had promised it to be
[*]You need to pay for other civilisations (why bother buying the damn game at all)
[*]The game is actually boring
[*]Needs a lot of optimisation
[/list]

There are better options like 0 A.D. and Age of Empires Online (Project Celeste) which will keep you occupied.

I cant really recommend this for any reason other than try it and see for yourself?

author: {'steamid': '76561198044661592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1584206447}
review:
Overall, game is good, stable, easy to find ranked opponents. 

I am not an AoE player, I mostly play Starcraft Brood War, but this was easy to get hang of after one skirmish vs. AI and the game was a blast at ranked after that.

The graphics have great style, though the UI could be larger. I find myself squinting to check whether my buildings are actually producing after a multiselect.

Another critisism would be the fact that the game doesn't recognize numbers input when a different language layout is used. This might be problematic in the future, would recommend to fix that.

Otherwise, the game is fun, there's micromanagement involved since units have abilities (like Byzantine disruption, which makes your opponent units vulnerable to your heavy cavalry charges). I enjoyed this thoroughly without any crashes or problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161172613', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1588451294}

author: {'steamid': '76561198282964049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1540791505}
review:
Vamos a ver... el juego en gráficos está bien hecho todo lo visual le doy un 10. La banda sonora me ha gustado mucho y no es algo que moleste mucho mientras uno juega, todo  bien.
El paso de las unidades entre ellas esta bien hecha, me gusta que cada facción sea diferente en el sentido de que no todas las unidades son iguales o que tienen la misma cantidad de hablidades y fuerzas, pongo por ejemplo: "los sacerdotes"
Tiene muchas caracteristicas del AoE2 (como dice todo el mundo) pero todo juego tiene sus pequeñas diferencias. Y TODO JUEGO TIENE COMO BASE ALGO... eso se lo crítico a la gente que solo dice: "Lo copiaron del AoE2". Analicen bien los puntos de vista, sean de mente abierta.
Ahora lo que no me ha gustado para nada es la seleccion de unidades dentro de la partida y que el resto de facciones del juego tengas que comprarla, para eso mejor dame campañas para comprar o skins no sé, no solo una facción por 5$.
Este juego todavía tiene mucho potencial, no lo dejen morir porfavor!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070310526', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1539895690}
review:
Ok lets talk a little truth here. I get that many people want for this game to be good, but its actually not.
And as an Age of Empires fan I say that its a disgrace to compare this game to an AOE game.
The stupid pathfinding is not working and in my opinion in a RTS this is game breaking.
The fact that it has become free to play but you have to pay 4 euro to play each faction (except for the Byzantines which are the only free faction) its just stupid, I cant get mad anymore its just plain stupid.
Dont waste your time with this game and be sure not to buy it cause its a frustrating mess...
And every person that compares this game to AoE deserves a sarcastic laugh every time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065839242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1547575132}
review:
Its an awesome AOE 2 simulator with great potential. The only downside is just the one civilization in witch f2p players start off. I would recommend including at least 2 more civs with diffrents strengths and weaknesses. Its a fun game but kind of boring when all your friends have the same civ to play. I understand you can pay for others but just one right off the bat is quite extreme. I will be buying others civs and looking forward to the great work they r doing.

P.S: To all the negative reviews. Do you want RTS to be cool again? Stop complaing about how this and that isnt working or not enough uniqueness. RTS is pretty much dead this days and people seem to give negative review just for the small things. MAKE RTS GREAT AGAIN by showing some love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087420830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1574560541}
review:
1 race. really. WHILE I was trying the new free to play update, they shut down my game to update it wich required my game (I was trying the Aztecs and my brother the French) to restar midway through it. Only for me to re open and re host a game with my brother again, but they had made all the races but 1 unavailable.

Fail launch, redeeming free to play to gain players but cutting our ankles by letting us play mad mirror byzantine matches, or spend 7$ an extra faction (if u add them all together, it costs us the initial game price).

Only saving grace went full retard and now the only player base you could get is still not gonna play it.


Better play Age Of Empires 2, at least they know whats up

author: {'steamid': '76561197991558233', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1539729896}
review:
Nice game with somehow a unique graphic design which is welcome. From my point of view, this game is extremly based on Age of Empires 2 HD since the scissors-paper-rock is very same. I did not paid attention to the defences ratio-attack-healthbar but the units are more less the same and the meta is quite similar: archers/cavalry at early to fast rush and then strnger ones to push.

That is not a bad thing.

Beside the similarity of Age of Empires 2 HD, the music is extremly pleasant and the unit's movement is really nice and enjoyable. It lacks a bit of pathfinding as AoE2 HD does, for example, when your units get stuck at wall-doors.

Also, it seems a bit more faster than is AoE2HD in tersm of attack-defending, more micro rather than macro maybe. A perception I have.


So, in a few words: free game to enjoy if you don't have AoE2 HD, or even if you have it you can change the game to vary a bit. Has a lot of potential and I hope it doesn't die here so it continues developing and improving aspects AoE 2 HD lacks hugely.

review: Игра топовая, но в сетевая игра никого нет, это не важно. Вообщем игра сыроватая, это очевидно, в дальнейшее обновление все ошибки и багов ,будет все исправлено. А так всем рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065680736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1662090307}
review:
Partiamo subito con la pillola amara: Empires Apart è semplicemente un buon gioco. Buono, ma anonimo.

In generale, trovo che il genere degli RTS stia decisamente invecchiando, e allontanarsi troppo dagli standard delle pietre miliari implica la riuscita di mischioni improponibili (di fatto, col tempo mi sono affezionato ad altri generi di videogames).

Ironicamente, ciò che divide gli RTS anonimi da quelli che rigiocheresti ad oltranza è, oltre appunto alla bontà del prodotto, tutta una serie di elementi apparentemente secondari che ti fanno affezionare al gioco. Anche una oramai sottovalutatissima campagna single player è più che sufficiente per creare coinvolgimento: Blizzard con il suo Warcraft 3 è l' esempio primevo di ciò; (segue a ruota Age of Mythology). Per non parlare di colonne musicali da oscar (E anche se quelle di un Age of Empires sono azzecatissime nella loro semplicità, il primo della classe in materia è e resterà Total Annihilation), e tutta una serie di "tocchi di classe" che danno pathos ed immersione ad ogni partita (La totale distruttibilità degli ambienti urbani di "codename Panzers" o il fatto di combattere ad una certa su distese di carcasse fumanti in "Supreme Commander".

Empires Apart è purtroppo privo di tutti questi elementi che non farebbero che valorizzarlo perché, pur trovandolo apprezzabilissimo sia ludicamente (complici alcuni aiuti tattici intelligenti, come la utilissima possibilità di selezionare SOLO le unità ferite) che graficamente (Oramai ho un debole per lo stile squadrato, sopratutto quello di Empires Apart mi ha ricordato il primissimo Virtual Fighter), ad un certo punto non ho resistito al tornare a giocare ad Age of Empires 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985215786', 'num_games_owned': 2073, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1522603734}
review:
Ho avuto il piacere di conoscere i ragazzi di DESTINYbit in concomitanza della Games Week 2015: nonostante il padiglione indie fosse relegato a un angolino, tra due chiacchiere e tanta simpatia, mi sono affezionato al loro esperimento di ricreare quella sensazione di strategia classica espressa dalla fantastica saga di Age Of Empires. All’epoca la mappa da me provata era uno scontro per conquistare la collina posta al centro: le civiltà a disposizione erano ancora acerbe, poco caratterizzate, ma l’ossatura base era già pronta, con raccoglitori, caserme e giovani disperati convinti di potermi battere solo perché disattento nel mio parlocchiare con uno degli sviluppatori.

Ad oggi, invece, Empires Apart non include più una modalità di gioco simile (nonostante ci sia ancora gente come il nostro Carmelo che si ostini a pensare di potermi battere), ma al suo posto l’intera struttura di gioco è stata stravolta, raffinata e pensata con un obiettivo molto chiaro: riformulare le regole delle battaglie con un ulteriore livello di profondità, il tutto in un’ottica spiccatamente online. Sì, perché Empires Apart è un gioco fortemente pensato per scontrarvi in rete con amici e sconosciuti: è presente anche una componente single player, ma questa è assolutamente inferiore, seppur importante. Ma vediamo con calma cos’hanno tirato fuori dal cappello gli amici di DESTINYbit.

È molto difficile che un amante dei giochi di strategia non sia rimasto folgorato delle gesta di William Wallace o Saladino, eppure una grande differenza che ci ha colpito del cugino Age Of Mythology è stato l’approccio al gameplay. Nel capitolo mitologico, infatti, ogni civiltà aveva un modo assolutamente unico di evolversi e combattere, il che rendeva l’esperienza molto più varia. Con grande sagacia, i ragazzi di DESTINYbit hanno ripreso tale idea e l’hanno applicata a otto civiltà (tra cui alcune nuove per il panorama), senza lasciarsi scappare l’attenzione ai dettagli per le piccole cose. Ecco quindi le immancabili frasi in lingua durante la selezione delle truppe, ma soprattutto una caratterizzazione attenta in base ai tratti culturali delle singole civiltà. Gli arabi, ad esempio, saranno fortemente aiutati dai propri centri universitari, i quali potenzieranno tutte le strutture belliche nelle vicinanze. O ancora, i cinesi potranno contare su un bonus produttivo a scapito della propria salute (la quale potrà essere sanata da potenti monaci), mentre i mongoli, famosi per essere nomadi, avranno dalla loro la libertà di non costruire edifici e degli arcieri a cavallo spietati. Sotto questo aspetto non v’è alcun dubbio di come la sensazione di giocare a Empires Apart ricordi molto Age Of Mythology.

Nonostante le molteplici prove, però, alcune civiltà richiedono ancora una certa limatura: le battaglie tra quelle affini per approccio (espansionisitico/difensivo/aggressivo) risultano equilibrate, ma l’incredibile velocità dei cinesi mal si sposa con la lenta seppur libera ideologia dei mongoli, rendendo gli scontri fin troppo brevi. Ad ogni modo, a questo si aggiungono altre piccole chicche che ho apprezzato molto, tra cui un accenno alla fisica degli combattimenti. Questo significa che attaccare da posizione superiore fornirà un lieve vantaggio, così come i più smanettoni potranno evitare parte dei danni delle frecce muovendosi in tempo una volta scagliate. Tanti piccoli tocchi di qualità che rendono il pacchetto generale molto interessante, anche se, e lo ripetiamo, il tutto va considerata sempre in chiave multiplayer. Sono disponibili anche schermaglie contro il computer (fino a 4vs4) e una serie di sfide che ricordano molto quelle di StarCraft II, le quali non solo vi impegneranno notevolmente nel cercare di completarle, ma di fatto vi insegneranno alcune tecniche avanzate molto preziose per le sfide online. È presente anche un semplice tutorial un po’ scarno, ma è chiaro che il prodotto pubblicato da Slitherine sia pensato per giocatori navigati di strategici.

Con grande rammarico, però, non sono solo le civiltà ad aver bisogno di un ritocchino, ma anche il codice di gioco. Sono stati frequenti i momenti in cui alcune unità si siano bloccate in mezzo agli alberi, non raggiungessero la destinazione data (senza incontrare ostacoli) o, peggio, l’eroe rimanesse impantanato in una radura durante la modalità Assassinio (in cui l’eroe è l’UNICA unità da proteggere a tutti i costi). Per di più, le mappe, seppure generate casualmente, offrono poche opzioni di personalizzazione e rispecchiano più o meno sempre lo stesso pattern — è un peccato che quella a “Isole” abbia solo 2 isole e mezzo anche a livello enorme. Per finire, il comando di movimento offensivo (che prevede l’attacco alla vista di un nemico) non include una reale scala di priorità: queste dovrebbero tenere in considerazione prima i nemici e solo dopo le costruzioni. Purtroppo però, i nostri soldati si perderanno durante questo movimento, sparpagliandosi e attaccando anche elementi meno rilevanti (come pezzi di mura mentre vengono colpiti da arcieri). Senza dubbio questo limita l’utilizzo di una scorciatoia vitale per il genere, in particolar modo per gli scontri online.

E qui cade come un martello la seconda grossa critica a Empires Apart: dopo aver giocato sia contro l’IA che contro altri giocatori (ahimè veramente pochi in questo momento), sembra quasi che la natura multiplayer del gioco non sia supportata a dovere da tutte le sue componenti. Chiariamoci, le idee inserite e il tratto personale di DESTINYbit sono estremamente interessanti e degni di nota (sarà anche ora di avere maggiore fisica negli strategici), ma la maniera in cui il prodotto è confezionato fa un po’ a pugni con l’idea di offrire un’esperienza online. Se considerato come un RTS rapido, il confronto con un mostro sacro quale StarCraft annulla ogni speranza; viceversa, se preso con più tranquillità, l’assenza di opzioni, le poche modalità (più l’assenza di popup che spiega l’obiettivo di queste) e i glitch fin qui descritti purtroppo finiscono per rovinare il piacevole effetto di un gameplay vario e divertente. Nutro comunque fiducia nei ragazzi italiani, i quali hanno già promesso nuove mappe per le modalità di gioco e che sicuramente interverranno a sistemare i bug, tra cui anche i testi a schermo a volte in italiano e a volte in inglese. Detto ciò, se volete supportare il team nostrano (cosa che io consiglio a prescindere), trovate Empires Apart su Steam a 28 euro.

Ho convertito i nemici dell’islam e sacrificato i nemici degli aztechi grazie a un codice gentilmente offerto da Slitherine.

5.5

author: {'steamid': '76561198020277065', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1557857415}
review:
Before you buy (and look at the Mixed Review rating!):

Empires Apart is probably the most fun RTS game that I have found in the steam store when browsing for a game that can check off all the boxes for me! But it does have it's issues that I will get to later.

I always buy new RTS games and then end up never playing them again after 20 minutes or never even playing at all, but Empires Apart has SO much character, potential, and simple unique touches, that it makes me want to keep playing EVEN in it's current buggy state.

It is simple, yet fun, much like, in my opinion, Age of Empires 3 and Stronghold Crusader. Meanwhile, most other RTS games, remind me more of Age of Empires 2 and Stronghold Crusader 2. In the latter, you have way too many complexities added which make the game hard to get into and if you step away for to long you hesitate to start up again, while in the former, you have a game that's very easy to pick up whenever you feel like it, easy to understand, and easy to master.

So with that said Empires Apart is an RTS that is so easy to pick up and play. Its a game that makes you want to keep playing for hours and hours. It's art is unique, it's civilizations are great (can't wait for additions!), and the building/unit options are very interesting.

HOWEVER, I keep hoping that every patch (great job by the developers by the way, they are working hard to fix the issues they have) it will fix the FATAL ERROR crash that makes you instantly have to close the game. This is unfortunate as you never know when it's going to hit. Could be 10 minutes in, could be 45 minutes in. **With the most recent update, I was finally able to play a FULL game without a crash :)** It just plain sucks to have this crash, as it makes it unplayable. I always want to launch the game but then I don't because I know I won't get anywhere. BUT most games I don't even want to launch even when they are fully bug-free, so very big thank you to the developers for making such a captivating game, even in its current state!

PROS
- The graphics (some disagree, but I think it fits)
- The sound effects and the music are very nice!
- Unique, small differences between some units is very cool.
- Cool Civilization and Hero concept.

CONS 
- FATAL ERROR bug.
- No campaign.

I won't give up on Empires Apart, neither will the developers. I suggest that you don't either!

Buy the game on sale if you have your doubts, but even so, when this game becomes bug-free, it will have a great friendly and strong community behind it. Mark my words :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074295304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1554415945}
review:
Hello there! As a brief introduction, I'm a HUGE fan of RTS. I've played a lot of them during my lifetime (Age of Empires, Starcraft, Empire Earth, Command and Conquer, Homeworld, etc.) - I can write paragraphs of lots of info and opinions here and there, but I'll attempt to structure somehow via pros and cons (and "neutral"). Oh, and I'm also just a casual RTS player, I don't do much multiplayer on any of those and just like to chill and do AI stomping (I've done a bit of competitive in the past, but it got way too stressful for me lol)

PROS: 
+ Solid gameplay: Not gonna lie, most of it is from Age of Empires 2, but there are new things that are introduced here though (such as the more simplified upgrade into tiers and hero units). And yes, I'm aware that some people see this as unoriginal and "copying", but you know what they say, you don't fix something that ain't broke. They're taking Age of Empires 2 core stuff and improving upon it. We don't have to reinvent the wheel each time. The civilizations and core gameplay of each of them are similar, but they have enough individual characteristics, that they don't feel like you're playing the same game over and over (what with different heroes to choose from, civilization passives/active abilities, and difference in gameplay and techtrees)

+ Visuals: Okay, I know that in terms of pure gaming experience, visuals isn't absolutely essential in terms of gameplay and mechanics, but it IS an important factor. While the aesthetics of it being polygon-y is surely a matter of taste (I like it to be honest), it's cool to be able to enjoy a good strategy game while enjoying the scene. I like how the civilizations are presented visually, while not entirely new, they definitely feel very different from each other.

+ Music: I'm not like a musical guru or anything like that, but man the music in this game is awesome. From the menu music all the way to the music in the game itself (general or civ-based themes are so good to listen to while you do your own thing! :D)

CONS:
- Incomplete Game: Now I haven't followed everything that the devs are doing or whatnot, and when I purchased this game, it didn't indicate that it is "Early Access" or anything - but regardless of the reasoning (intentional or not, time constraints or not), the game feels incomplete. First of all, there's no campaign. Secondly, even the repetitive content in the game doesn't seem to give you an awful load of options (not a lot of maps to choose from, etc.). But it seems that the devs are quite active and might release some huge updates or even DLCs, but as of now... you have the core game that RTS player wants (which is good), but not a lot of other stuff (which, most other players want, RTS fans or just casuals - which is bad).

- Replayability: Competitive games and RTS can be inherently replayable depending on your interest in it, since it's the kind of game you want to get better at and keep on playing and playing, but... as I've said before, there's no campaign and it doesn't seem like there's a whole lot else to do, so that in turn makes the game less interesting (what holds you back to this game?), thus the replayability suffers.

- Pricetag: Now okay, pricing and "what's worth to you" is mostly subjective and depends on the person buying. But we live in a day and age where there are games out there of amazing quality that costs much less (or even free sometimes). And while that might seem an unfair thing to say, it is relevant here, because the pricetag seems to be way too steep for what the game currently offers (as of this review).

NEUTRAL:
- Copy-paste Game: As I've mentioned above, it's no secret that this game is VERY similar to Age of Empires 2. While I've stated that for me it's a good thing, it might not be to some. Honestly I don't mind that they took something amazing and improved upon it (both mechanically and visually) - but to some people it might not be worth a whole new game. I've put it here again as neutral, just because it really depends on you if this is something important to you or not.

CONCLUSION:
I am still putting this game as recommended, because if you're a fan of RTS and have some money to spare  or a casual, this might be a good game to look into if you like the RTS genre. Why do I say this? Well, as I've said above, it is VERY similar to Age of Empires 2 yes, but it's an "updated" one, so visually it's better and the mechanics are also better (my opinion - this isn't fact, lower the pitchforks). 
BUT, the pricetag and the lack of content (other than the core RTS skirmish mode) is off-putting - I sincerely hope that they somehow lower the pricetag and/or release contents on this game rather soon - otherwise people might start jumping off ship. Which would be unfortunate, because this game has the potential to be something amazing.

review:
This game plays a lot like the Age of Empires series, especially Age of Empires 2. This has been discussed heavily so I won’t get into it any further.

The graphic style is really 50/50, half of us love it and half of us hate it. I think it’s cool, just that it has been done too much lately across games of all genres.

Gameplay is pretty smooth. 

More civilizations are always welcome. 

The game definitely needs more polishing but as of right now it’s solid enough.

7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037456732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1530350845}
review:
This may sound like a Positive review, but bear with me.

Empires Apart attempts to relight the fire of the RTS genre. It has everything you know and love, rescource management, military formations and Zerg rushes.
This game is great for the new wave of RTS fans, for those that could not start with AOE2 due to its age. If you are like myself and have been around to play them, it feels like a reskin of that very game.
If this game was early access, I would forgive the level of ambition this shows. If the game gets regular updates and a few more factions i would happily change my opinion.

This sadly does not bring anything new to the RTS like it was suggested at Alpha, it is a pretty game. But feels like a very casual game.

TL;DR
Do you like Age of Empires? Do you like Empire Earth?
Then play those.

Good: for the newbie
Bad: for the veteran
Ugly: this game is not

-----------------------------------
Thanks for reading

author: {'steamid': '76561198081181251', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1522820302}
review:
Fun game, a nice take on a modern RTS. Severely lacks a following which is sad - with great support it could develop into an awesome game. It has a lot of personality and civilization unique-ness, but, no campaign/story mode.

I'm not sure a new golden age of RTSs will ever spawn again with so many other genres/competitive games that seem to be more accessible and user-friendly. Even with Age of Empires 4 in the works, I don't expect anything to revive this genre if this couldn't get some kind of following.

If you do enjoy RTSs though, I'd definitely recommend getting this game ONLY if you have people to play with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212838591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1630165758}
review:
因为迷即时战略游戏，在看到这个有趣，又富含多元历史文化背景的RTS的时候就立马入手了。虽然多单位操作的时候，特别是微操的时候，游戏经常反应比较迟钝，编队下的反应也相当一般。但是还是很有冲动要给好评。
但是，最近一次打开游戏的小型战争界面，发现整个屏幕都被强烈的地图内的太阳光照着，根本看不到基地。本来以为操作单位到地图其他位置，就没有这个问题。结果这个强烈的光源始终在屏幕中间！这简直不能忍啊！根本无法继续游戏！
觉得是不是我电脑问题的思考下，我重新下载了游戏，发现情况还是如旧
一怒之下 过来写个差评
虽然是独立游戏，bug什么的都能忍，但是这种让游戏完全无法继续的错误，实在是不能忍，希望工作室能够尽快恢复

author: {'steamid': '76561198056117802', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2991, 'last_played': 1573160540}
review:
Quick verstion:

Fast paced AoE like RTS with more competitive playability.
Not quite finished but devs are active and i have my hopes up.


New Review of the Free to Play version:

First of all im almost satisfied that i dont get totally fucked for buying this game in the first place, even tho i got plents of the DLC civs (already existing before), i am missing one, which i dont like that much since i still have a feeling i paid enough already, but its OK.

The gameplay so far is pretty nice, the costumisations they added also make it a little more fun, all this stuff they put in all new games was added, but its not changing the gameplay.

Gameplay is really fun and they made a few tweaks to aoe2 i like, even tho pathfinding and movement bugs are still far too common but im in good believe this will be fixed at some point.

To multiplayer:
Since there arent really enough players yet you will get ranked against people of a different skill level a lot, tho the speed of the gameplay makes up for it bc you dont build for 10 minutes until you realise that your opponent isnt even building gathering camps.
So unfair games are fast over and dealt with, which is much less frustrating for both players.

Not so sure about the balancing yet, but still its aight so far since i know the elo of people defeating me in the 2k+ (diamond) range which is the same thing in AoE2, but slower and more painful. Here he just arrived after 2-3 Mins and if your not prepared its over fast. 

So atm im putting my hope and gametime in the game and try to spread it among my friends. 
Will also stay in touch with the devs so final bugs can be fixed.

Hoping for a well made competitive fast paced AoE2 like RTS with more players in the future a lot!





Old:
Good Game, slightly overpriced.

The Devs still working hard on the project and its getting a really good game slowly, though the bad reviews and high price make it really hard for it to get popular, which is a real problem for a multiplayer based game.

Maybe after first big sale, there will be enough players and enough is fixed the game may start rolin or otherwise i see a soon to be dead game here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143417135', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1527211332}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965619410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1636745716}
review:
Really, very much enjoying this, but it did its very best to put me off. 

I refunded this game twice before committing to a purchase. The first playthrough felt very bland, but actually so does AOE too until you get into the game’s pacing. I decided to give it a second chance and purchased again. This time I set up a 6 player skirmish vs AI (medium) match and while I really enjoyed the economy (loved it in fact), the AI pretty much ignored me and went to sleep. I refunded again but found myself thinking about the game a lot. That's often the sign of an interesting game, so I fully committed and purchased it a third time. In the next few matches the AI seemed much more aggressive and challenging. It seems to choose from a pre-determined type (turtle, early push, mixed), but from Medium to Hard AI, I was pushed to keep pace with the pressure. 

The game is beautiful to look at, with superb music and excellent voice reactions. Animations are also very good. The economy is varied and fun, and the various upgrade paths keep things interesting until the late game phase, and the way the buildings knit together makes a huge difference to the game's visuals. Battles are fine, and feel very much like Star Craft or AOE. Once you've got a flourishing economy booming, it looks great. 

The main issue is that the game is clearly still a beta product. Animals spin around when their path-finding gets stuck. The game can suddenly CTD when things are getting interesting, and there's clearly a lot of menu work still to be done. The AI is interesting at times, but needs to get better, and pathfinding in general needs to improve. I'm enrolled on the Steam Beta version now and certainly things seem better, but far from perfect yet. Fix those CTD please!!!

So, a lot to moan about, but generally this is a great AOE style game, and I'm thoroughly enjoying it so far. It feels a little more like one of the Empire Earth games from the early 2000s, and that's no bad thing. In fact, the game it most reminds me of is the awesome (for the time), and very broken Warrior Kings: Battles. It's actually nothing like that game but it does sort of have that vibe.

Anyway, great fun and it'll be even better when the patching's done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088848705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1566853041}
review: Increíble juego, me alegra tanto que haya gente que desee tanto como yo el renacimiento de RTS al estilo Age of Empires, del cual soy un gran fan, le faltan ciertos detalles, como sonidos y ciertas mejoras a la IA de pathfinding y unos pequeños ajustes en la jugabilidad, sobretodo en la cuestión de selección de unidades y áreas. Lo recomiendo ampliamente, hay que apoyar estos proyectos, desde hacía tiempo le estaba dando seguimiento al juego, hasta que recién me enteré que lo lanzaron, comprando el juego y marcando los errores con críticas constructivas se apoya al desarrollador, que repito, hizo un excelente trabajo. La jugabilidad de cada civilización es bastante única, los tipos de unidades y las mecánicas de cada una son muy buenas, mucha variabilidad y sin embargo aún comparten muchas mecánicas básicas, me recuerda mucho a AoE3, he jugado Aztecas, he quedado muy contento, la IA bastante complicada he de decir, pero es un buen reto para mejorar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028156817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7858, 'last_played': 1526279456}
review:
Do not buy this game. I've played Empires Apart for over 140 hours and been a loyal supporter of the game since it was just concept art. At every given opportunity I was there to help. I playtested the game throughout development, but ultimately I saw Empires Apart grow into something I cannot recommend to anyone. I am incredibly disappointed in how this game turned out and how unprofessional the developers have been to the community. This game is a buggy, incomplete, rushed, border-line unplayable mess of an RTS game that broke the many promises it made to its loyal Alpha and Beta testers. If you're looking for an Early Access game with almost no Single Player and absolutely no playerbase for Multiplayer, then that's unfortunately Empires Apart. 

This game actually does have potentially good gameplay that is remiscent of the classic 90's RTS titles that I love (with over 2000 hours in Age of Empires II: HD Edition, not including the CD version). As a big fan of Aoe2, Age of Mythology, Star Wars Galactic Battlegrounds, Warcraft 3, Starcraft II, and more, I did generally enjoy the gameplay of Empires Apart. The gameplay is actually very fun and well-designed, borrowing from the classic 90s RTS formula but adding some welcomed twists that help make the experience unique. However, the game itself is consistently riddled with hilarious exploits and major balance issues that kill the game the more you learn about it. That's assuming of course that you can actually play it when it isn't crashing 24/7. In my 140 hours of Empires Apart I have completed exactly 1 full Multiplayer game and that was during the Closed Beta. That is unforgivable. I was always playing with different people too so it's the game that is broken. The Publisher gave plenty of time with development, so it is unfortunately the Developers who openly pretend that they shipped a complete product and show absolutely no respect for all the Alpha and Beta testers that got them this far. 

Without a Singleplayer Campaign and an incredibly lazily implemented cheating AI (that just gets infinite resources and infinite Stone), the game has poor if not almost non-existent Singleplayer. The Skirmish mode is bare-bones and barely customizable. I don't know how and why that's the case but this game is simply not worth buying without a Campaign as there is no Multiplayer playerbase to play online and the multiplayer itself is very very unstable. 

Expect them to release some more broken DLC civilizations later and the playerbase to dip back down again shortly after to around 5 players if they continue this ridiculous "multiplayer-only" philosophy. That philosophy does not work in a classic-style RTS game that is supposed to be competitive yet offers no proper tools for players to learn, like a Campaign, replays, spectating outside of a lobby, better tutorials, and the most basic of features. And again the multiplayer itself is still awful with the rampant bugs, lag, balance issues, constant crashing, bare-bones lobbies, poor pathfinding, and overall incomplete gameplay. I mean look at how terrible the navy is! 

I'm a huge fan of classic RTS games and I will happily edit my review in a heartbeat if the developers showed for just a moment that they actually cared about their customers who ask for a Campaign, but instead of implementing a Campaign they ignore all criticism and suggestions, and are always working against the clock to fix a broken product that should have never been shipped the way it was. If I could describe this game in one word it would be:

Disappointing

It had so much potential to be great but in the end it was squandered. It's a shame. I'll be keeping my eye out in case things change and the developers start caring about their players, and if that ever happens I'll gladly edit this review. But don't hold your breath. The gameplay is good but it's honestly wasted here unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043567666', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1673570528}
review:
Heres your 10 step guide to create a successful early access steam game!

Step 1: Sell game for expensive monies.
Step 2: Scare away all the players with the price tag, bugs and poor optimisation.
Step 3: Make it free to play with only one civilization playable out of 6.
Step 4: Give all the people who bought the game a "founders status"
Step 5: Give the founders a soundtrack as compensation for going free to play. 
Step 6: Release new civilization for even more monies.
Step 7: Give promises about how amazing the game will be in future.
Step 8: Release a banner that you can build in game for expensive gold. 
Step 9: Don't fix bugs.
Step 10: Get popcorn.

Big promises, small deliveries.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328533689', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1523269113}
review:
前言
Hello，大家好，我是你们的老朋友侍君，这一次，我又有幸的参与到了新一期的小黑盒众测计划当中，得以体验这款steam的新游戏，帝国之间。作为一款RTS游戏，不得不说，从我刚看到这款游戏的第一眼起，我就感觉这个开发商很有想法，在后续的体验中，我的这个想法也得到了验证。
本测评是基于Beta测试版本。
游戏简介
中文名称：帝国之间
英文名称: Empires Apart
类型: 策略
开发商: DESTINYbit 
发行商: Slitherine Ltd.	
发行日期: 2018年3月29日
详细介绍
游戏借鉴了很多RTS游戏的优点，并且游戏的处处都有着帝国时代的影子。
在资源方面，游戏分为食物、木材、黄金、石头四种资源，各个资源的获取也有着各自的途径，例如食物既可以从各种野生动植物上面获取，又可以通过种植庄稼的方式获得。游戏中的资源算不上丰富但也足够前期的发展，但是到达某种程度之后，便不得不四处攻伐或者到远处寻找资源。这在一定程度上加快了游戏的节奏。


在建筑系统方面，游戏的建造系统简单但是却有很多的发展方向，游戏分为经济发展方向和军事发展方向，每一个方向的提升需要消耗一定量的资源，而且需要一段冷却时间。每一种发展方向均可以解锁更高级的军事建筑或者经济建筑。当然，也可以两方均提升，但是消耗的资源也会增加。所以，在游戏的前期，确定一个正确的发展方向，是必要的。

除去与帝国时代2相似的地方，游戏的种族系统是一个不同的地方，不同的种族有不同的领袖，不同的领袖有不同的能力，而且不同的种族拥有着各自不同的地方，例如蒙古，蒙古最大的特点就是可以和游牧民族一样，搬起自己的建筑到处乱跑。这点在游玩的时候确实是让我开心了很久。中国人的英雄有岳飞和诸葛亮两个，岳飞偏向于战斗，诸葛亮更加偏向于防守，从这几点可以看出，游戏的开发者是有研究的。
游戏支持多人在线联机，并且分为排位和非排名两种，单人本地游玩也有生存、小型对战和挑战三种玩法。


游戏的多人联机基本上已经大致定型，可以正常的进行对战。但是单人本地游玩的AI智商感人，自动寻路经常会被奇怪的物体卡住。
游戏有官方自带的简体中文并且中国人是中文配音。不过汉化还不完善，有些地方没有汉化或者汉化不完全。


游戏评价
这款游戏如果只是游玩单人无疑会很无聊，因为游戏的AI智商很感人，尽管我的难度不是最高的，也是处于一个中等的水平，如果要是单人，完全可以玩成一个生存游戏。
游戏糅合了市面上很多知名RTS游戏的优点，开发商很有野心也很有想法，但是目前的版本来看质量比较差，如果正式版不做出一些比较大的改动，这款游戏想要有所突破无疑会是很难的。
总结
优点：
独具特色的种族系统
沿袭了帝国时代的操作
上手简单
节奏较快
缺点：
优化有点差
画质有特点但容易出戏
单人AI智商感人
汉化不完全
场景简陋

说实话，进入游戏的第一眼，令我比较的失望，和我想象的完全不一样，能明显的感觉到，开发商虽然有心但却无力，但是在我深入游玩的情况下，我感觉到，虽然游戏有很多的缺点，但是却有一种魔力，能够让人在天梯对战中停不下来。

author: {'steamid': '76561198356585689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2011, 'last_played': 1556386266}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010550956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1523486090}
review:
A fun game hindered by some balancing issues and the sin that it has more of a focus on MP than SP, with no campaign to speak of (although you do have skirmishes, challenges and survival mode).

This game is heavily inspired from Age of Empires 2.

I know; i was shocked as well.

Jokes aside the title has so-so reviews because of bugs, many of which seem to have been fixed. Balancing issues will probably take a little longer to iron out but they're on the right path.

Main difference between this and AoE2 is the fewer, but unique, civs, with all of them having major alterations to gameplay. This means it can take a while to learn them all but also that fights can become more interesting and that clear-cut tactics vs certain civs aren't yet a thing. Matches also take less time since there is no linear tech tree to progress through, meaning that a player that knows that he's doing can get to good units much faster, but at the risk of remaining behind with his economy.


I would recommend it for the AoE2 multiplayer enthusiast who wants a game that is both new and familiar while still having many unexplored strategies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088359350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1576785398}
review:
A highly fun, fast paced RTS game.

As a person with over 2000 hours in AoE2 over various platforms, Empires Apart really catches that same feeling I get playing AoE2.

It has a beautiful soundtrack, the 6 civs are each unique and offer different styles of play, the challenges for single player are interesting and above all the multiplayer is competitive and compelling.

The low poly art style might be highly divisive, but personally I enjoy it. As a competitive player visual clarity is super important and the buildings are great in this aspect, not to mention the UI is very clean and having the majority of the screen free is a very nice result. While the units are a little more difficult to distiunguish immediately - that's probably just me not playing the game enough yet to learn them! 

There is currently no campaign, although the devs have said they would add one in future. Skirmish mode is nice, there have been patches improving the AI - it's already pretty good - and I hope it will improve further. The developers are incredibly active, more than I have ever seen for any other game, so I have high hopes for the future.

I'd rate this game as it is currently 08/04/2018: 
8.5/10 for multiplayer
6/10 for single player (will greatly go up with a campaign)

I would highly recommend this game for those who enjoy multiplayer in RTS style games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085454636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1563886088}
review:
Au début j'étais sceptique au vu des évaluations variables. Je savais que le jeu étais majoritairement multijoueur donc je n'ai pas été déçue du manque de campagne. J'ai été agréablement surpris par les graphismes, les civilisations totalement différentes, chacunes a ses avantages, ses inconvénients, ses unités propres et ses technologies avec un gameplay riche qui rappel celui d'AOE2 en plus dévellopé. Les unités ont des compétences spéciales pour certaines, cela donne de belle microgestion et de très beau mouvement sur le champ de batailles (je pense surtout aux paladin francs)

Mais d'un autre coté les menus et la création de parties sont vraiment mal travailler. on pourrait critiquer aussi le manque de map, mais je pense que les dévellopeurs en apporteront ainsi que des nouvelles civilisations. 

Cependant en toute honnêté c'est un très bon rts multijoueur, et sa richesse de gameplay et la diversité qu'offre les civilisations effacent la plupart des petits défauts de ce jeu.

c'est un bon investissement

author: {'steamid': '76561197972243781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2250, 'last_played': 1550185962}
review:
I really wanted to give this game a positive review. Even made a big thread on the Forum what to fix as fast as possible. This game is 100 percent an early access game. Not more, not less.

The basegame looks fine. Different Civs that all play a little bit different and the graphic is something different. I like it.

But the game lacks in content: No campaign nothing.

If you want to play against KI....well the KI is beyond stupid. Worse than in Age of Empires Definitve Edition (look it up on youtube). 

So the only thing you can do is multiplayer but it crashes, is laggy as hell despite having high end PC's. 
The 6 Civs are unbalanced as hell. Pathfinding is Alpha status etc etc.

In short:

Positive: 

-6 Civs

-graphic is nice

negative:

pathfinding
AI
horrible perfomance unplayable 3v3 or 4v4
crashes every second game
lack on content (no campaign nothing)

This game might be good in 6 months but they do sell it as a full game so I have to make a negative here.
