author: {'steamid': '76561198053943565', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3466, 'last_played': 1545337107}
review:
We don't see competitive-multiplayer focused Age of Empires-like games often.
This one, gives you solid mechanics, fun gameplay, good artstyle, unique civilizations and build diversity. Sure, game is not polished but it's very playable and getting good support from devs.
If you want to compare it to first times of AoE 2 HD and AoE Online, Empires Apart is 100 times better.

"Single player only" players wouldn't find much content here, I can't recommend the game for them. Competitive-RTS lovers must definitely give it a try.

Edit: Multiplayer is dead, there is not a single chance to revive it, DON'T BUY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204043497', 'num_games_owned': 1390, 'num_reviews': 420, 'playtime_forever': 4080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2668, 'last_played': 1540950480}
review:
怎么说呢，这是一款帝国时代里的文明6吧。为什么这么说，大家都知道帝国时代是写实2D的RTS吧，而文明4， 5也是写实画风吧，到了文明6就变成了Q版。《Empires Apart》这款也有异曲同工之处，有着和帝国时代差不多的模式玩法，但画风改成了Q版《Empires Apart》相对于帝国时代，细节方面加了特别多，就如同文明6与文明5的差别一样。

特别喜欢帝国时代系列，这里给自己自荐一下自己录制的帝国全系列视频吧。https://www.bilibili.com/video/av20387691
    
纵观20年的游戏史，像《魔兽争霸3》、《星际争霸》、《命令与征服》、《英雄连》、《全面战争》等RTS都是比较出名的。而Empires Apart也是一款RTS。既然是RTS，那肯定有阵营之分，下面来简述一下各个文明吧。
[h1]拜占庭文明：[/h1]
[b]在史实中：[/b]又称东罗马帝国。自古罗马帝国就有着非常强大的步兵，比如说熟为人知的斯巴达士兵。这里就不说明分裂罗马的原因了，西罗马保持原先的罗马帝国制度和军事，东罗马则开始探索骑兵的训练。
[b]在游戏中：[/b]拜占庭是综合性文明，军事经济都相互依赖着。比如军事方面依靠步兵配合骑兵作战，步兵拥有干扰敌方部队的技能，骑兵攻击被干扰的部队会有翻倍伤害加成，前期5个步兵加上送的侦察兵就可以旗开得胜一波。信仰方面，牧师可以增加周围村民的效率，加快经济发展。没有强大的堡垒士兵但可以升级防御型塔楼，主城的防御相对其他文明是较为强大的。海上部队拥有克制船舰的喷火船，加上有着加强型战船完全可以称霸海域。
[h1]法国文明：[/h1]
[b]在史实中：[/b]法兰克王国。当初的日耳曼人对于罗马人而言就是野蛮人，而法兰克人就是入侵西罗马帝国的日耳曼民族中的一支，后来成为了基督教大国。法兰克人注重骑兵训练，有着颇为强大的重装骑兵——圣骑士。
[b]在游戏中：[/b]法国拥有强大的骑兵阵容，所以一定要先出军事把马厩造出来。圣骑士血量和攻击力远超其他文明的所有骑兵，重型反骑兵拥有冲刺技能，可以对其他文明的骑乘部队造成大量伤害。而堡垒里出的重骑兵更是逆天，高输出高血量就算了下马还能憋血，后期简直强无敌！同时还拥有比较丰富的攻城武器！信仰方面，牧师可以永久增加部队的攻击力和护甲。
[h1]中国文明：[/h1]
[b]在史实中：[/b]四大发明——火药发明的国家，同时三国时期改革了远程武器弓弩——诸葛弩，让中国人在远程与攻城的军事配置上有着超前世界的实力。同时还有神秘的中国功夫和少林子弟。
[b]在游戏中：[/b]中国是个特别特殊的文明，咱先不说Empires Apart，在帝国2里就有诸葛弩这种逆天的弓箭手，而在帝国3中更有攻击力特别高的少林武僧。所以在这里，中国是弓箭手特别强大的，除去原有的诸葛弩，堡垒还有个特别逆天的狙击手！同时还有着古代中国的火药文明，制造一名技师，就可以建造出5种攻城武器。信仰方面，少林和尚既是治疗部队的奶爸也是高输出的战士。但是，中国没有经济科技很吃亏，而是有着一种叫“监视”的技能，这个技能会增加效率，但每次上交资源的时候，村民会掉5点血，所以一定要赶紧出基础经济，把少林和尚造出来奶村民，这才是可持续发展呀。
[h1]阿拉伯文明：[/h1]
[b]在史实中：[/b]撒拉逊人，信奉伊斯兰教，当时的阿拉伯人意图改变全世界的信仰，让全世界都信仰伊斯兰，也正是这样得罪了欧洲的基督教天主教教徒，才有了后来的“十字军东征” 。
[b]在游戏中：[/b]阿拉伯这个文明很中规中矩，特点就是没有什么特点，所以会比较难掌握。这个文明的通常部队都平庸无奇没有特殊技能，也就是说前中期时是特别容易欺负的。不过拥有六大文明中唯一一个有着转化部队能力牧师，并且还有专门的奶爸——医师。到了后期出了一定要先进军事，出堡垒，才有制胜的本钱，在堡垒中生产刺客，可以进行暗杀，并且实施暗杀后邻近部队都会处于惊吓状态降低移动速度和护甲。总之是个比较难上手的文明。
[h1]阿兹特克文明：[/h1]
[b]在史实中：[/b]阿兹特克人由于荣冠战争的思想引导着，相当好战，并且有捕获俘虏论功行赏的制度。虎武士和鹰武士都是阿兹特克的精英战士，虎武士全身虎皮包裹，鹰武士则是头戴老鹰头饰。当阿兹特克战士捕获4名俘虏后便会晋升为鹰武或虎武，这个身份表明了在阿兹特克里的特权，可以娶妻纳妾等等。
[b]在游戏中：[/b]阿兹特克这个文明就是为了战争而生的，一句话就是战，几乎没有科技，步兵只有战斗才能升级，越战越勇。城镇中心可以生产刺客，也就是夜间隐身的侦察兵。步兵开启技能后虽然伤害降低了但只要击中目标就会给予减速减护甲的负面buff，然后就是一边倒的虐，最后俘虏。信仰上也特别符合阿兹特克的文明，直接送个诅咒，全体负面buff，然后步兵又是上去一边倒的虐。所以一定要先出军事，阿兹特克也是唯一一个出军事解锁神庙的文明。没有骑兵，没有攻城武器，弱小的海军力量。
[h1]蒙古文明：[/h1]
[b]在史实中：[/b]游牧民族，马背民族，居无定所，以马为生。蒙古人擅射，弯弓射大雕，因此机动性高的蒙古弓骑最为强大。
[b]在游戏中：[/b]蒙古是游牧民族，除了蒙古包还是蒙古包，压根就没建筑可言，所以在这里蒙古的建筑是可以拆的，并且每一个蒙古包都是住房人口。拥有两种村民，一种是收集资源的，另一种叫做开荒者专门建筑的，当建筑拆了之后会变回开荒者。蒙古没有农田，食物来源在于村民采集其他资源自带30%的食物。蒙古没有步兵和步弓手，全部都是骑兵，开局就能造马厩但轻骑并不是优势，蒙古的强势在于弓骑所以也要赶紧的升级军事解锁弓营。蒙古骑兵都拥有嗜血的技能，越杀敌只会越强大！所以前期和中期，蒙古的军事机动性是最高的，能偷袭一定要冲上去偷袭，能避免打后期就一定要避免。
        
[u]有兴趣的玩家可以先单人游戏熟悉一下这个游戏的机制，然后再来多人对战。当然，这个游戏也有一个娱乐模式——生存模式，白天发展，晚上防御。[/u]
 
下面说说这款游戏和帝国时代的区别吧：
[i]1. 沿用了帝国时代2的基本操作，只要是老玩家一眼就能看出来：开局城镇中心，村民，侦察兵，还有可以作为前期食物来源可以宰割的羊，前期侦察兵探索，所有村民宰羊，所有食物造村民，出来的村民砍树，出来的第2个村民造住房……套路是一模一样的。但游戏更接近史实，并且6个文明，有6个模组，6个BGM，将文化多样性体现出来了。并且增加了时间系统，有昼夜之分。到了晚上刺客职业的单位可以隐身秒杀其他单位。[/i]
[i]2. 不再是黑暗时代、封建时代、城堡时代、帝王时代的改朝换代升级了，而是分成经济发展和军事发展两条支线，用400食物升级基础军事，400木头升级基础经济，然后军事和经济路线解锁的科技不同。[/i]
    
[spoiler]我的配置其实很低：
CPU：i5-5200U 2.2GHz
显卡：AMD R7 M260  2G
但是这款游戏全屏玩中高画质依旧有48帧，但是由于显卡负荷严重没办法录制和截图，输出的图像信息都是花的。[/spoiler]
 
如今当下快餐游戏比比皆是，3A大作泛滥的年代，能静下心来好好打一局几十小时的文明，打一局几个小时的帝国真的不容易！怎么说呢？这游戏打的就是情怀牌吧，用一个没有玩过的全新版本来吸引大量RTS老玩家关注这款游戏。事实证明，开发商没有辜负老玩家的关注，真的很好玩！历史细节植入非常详细，同时也没有破坏游戏的平衡性，各有各的优势各有各的打法。没有哪个文明可以完全克制哪个文明的，因此怎么发展只能靠你的脑子，你的指挥水平，你的策划能力，才有可能克制敌方。值得一提的是，若是想详细的了解古代世界历史，尤其是经济与军事这一块，这款游戏还真值得入手。毕竟二十四史，二十四家史也，中规中矩的史书基本写的政治，尤其是家天下的朝代，国史即是家史。而Empires Apart的文明虽然不多，只有6个，但开发商却把能够把这6个文明的历史表达的如此详细。这款游戏好似下棋，需要静下心，需要顾全大局，博弈之间是进攻还是防守，是发展还是弃子，都需深思熟虑。在当今浮躁的社会能找些朋友一起玩上一局真的不容易。

打分的话，我会给个8.9/10吧，并期待后续的开发更新和优化。毕竟历史带入感好强，每个文明每个单位每个建筑的模组和配音BGM都是不同的，多样性很出色！

author: {'steamid': '76561198252317968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1597178255}
review:
Es bueno el juego pero siento que le falta algo (aparte de mejorar la IA el Pathfinding etc. lo que ya se sabe)  espero que sigan agregando civilizaciones ,mapas y unidades por ejemplo los Aztecas son muy divertidos pero si no ganas al principio sera casi imposible al final  y ni se diga contra mongoles nunca alcanzas sus arqueros a caballo  jaja  

En cuanto a la optimizacion siento que le falta un poco  ya que tengo lo necesario y tengo que ponerlo todo en Bajo sino se pone muy lento , eso si los tiempos de carga son muy rapidos eso me agrado mucho =) 

Pues lo recomendare si te gustan este tipo de juegos y con esperanza de que sigan dandole mucha atencion y añadan cosas al juego y no sea abandonado como un Down of war 3 xD  =(

author: {'steamid': '76561198086077072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1561504060}
review:
Pros
- Una version actualizada y mas acertada que AoE II HD.
- Uniformidad de Texturas e Interfaze, cosa que en AoE II HD no sucede con las recientes expansiones.
- Tiers de clasificacion y JcJ excelente.
Contras:
- Las unidades no tienen esos sonidos tan buenos y apasionados que poseia el AoE II HD.
- Faltan Civilizaciones iconicas del periodo VIkingos o Normandos, Ingleses, Españoles, Hindues, Persas o Japoneses.
- Quizas es demasiado 2 heroes a elegir, uno opcion basta.
- IA y Pathfinding de 1 a 10=4.
- Falta Opcion: Patrullar
- No se puede elegir color como en el AoE 2 HD

author: {'steamid': '76561198310023307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1522406080}
review: Niby kopia Age of Empires z lepsza grafika ale jest strasznie zbugowana, jednostki sie buguja, wszystko jest bardzo wolne, jestem wielkim fanem strategii, kocham AOE ale ta gra do mnie nie przemawia, a juz na pewno nie jest warta tych pieniedzy, jakbym wiedzial to za darmo bym tego nie sciagnal...Nie wspomne o niemozliwosci gry online z innymi, jak juz po 30min czekania na kogokolwiek lub jakis pokoj uda wam sie dolaczyc, gra sie buguje w ladowaniu i restartuje w kolko...

author: {'steamid': '76561198002747712', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 11994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1561571446}
review:
It has been a long time since there was a RTS game this great...

Playing some matches and watching some vods of the top players, it has a lot of potential on the micro/macro aspects. 
Also the design of the civilizations makes each one very pleasant to watch/play and try out.

The focus of the game is on the multiplayer side, so not much on the singleplayer, but it's very possible and only a matter of time... Game still has some bugs/problems but the team are fixing them and making patches as fast as they can.

If you like the RTS genre it's definitely worth trying this game out. Remember to join the discord :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198037829707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1587112143}
review: Jedyne co w tej grze jest dobre to grafika i podobieństwo. Gra całkowicie nie grywalna. Strasznie zacina( niezależnie od ustawieć graficznych). Sztuczna inteligencja działa na 40% (zazwyczaj jedynie buduje domy i szkoli osadników, nic ponad to). Mechanika rozgrywki identyczna do większości z tego gatunku. Najgorsze jest to że mając 1 konnego i 4 łuczników można wybić 100 wrogów, ponieważ inteligencja została celowo tak tępo ustawiona, że wrogie jednostki zawsze będą ganiać za tym kogo pierwszego wykryją i można ich wtedy beztresowo mordować. Po wydaniu pełnej gry spodziewałem się raczej czegoś innego, a to jest raczej jakaś pre alfa bety. Nawet map im się nie chciało dodać na premierę, więc w tybie przetrwania mamy tylko jedną mapę i piękny napis, że następne może się kiedyś pojawią.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030808608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1523003530}
review:
Gemessen an dem, was das Spiel vor der Early Access Phase suggeriert hat, macht es erstaunlich wenig Spaß. Das liegt im Wesentlichen an recht häufigen Abstürzen des Spiels, an der unterirdischen KI (auch wenn der Fokus auf MP liegt, erwartet man zumindest eine KI die überhaupt funktioniert) sowie auch an einer teilweise hakeliger UI-Steuerung. Inzwischen hat sich auch noch die Tatsache dazugesellt, dass mein AV-Programm die Anwendung, auf Grund ihres Verhaltens in die Virus-Quarantäne verschiebt. Das hatte ich bisher noch nie bei einem Spiel, in dieser Preisklasse, auch bei keinem Early Access Titel.
Da die EA-Phase erst kürzlich begonnen hat, würde ich dem Spiel aber noch einmal eine Chance geben. Aber dazu ist wohl noch viel Arbeit seitens der Entwickler nötig...

author: {'steamid': '76561198134535966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2558, 'last_played': 1632768689}
review:
Really fun rts with a lot of potential. Super good gameplay, some crazy micro potential, each civ play diffferently, fast pace. The perfect balance between Aoe2 macro and SC2 micro. Nice hotkeys and UI. Hero unit super fun to play. 

The only downside is the lack of singleplayer, but the soldid multiplayer makes up for it. The dev team is super dedicated and working hard to fix issues (mostly ai issues). 

Would recommend to any rts fan, and even new people in the genre because the game is easier to learn than most of rts i know.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010623551', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2750, 'last_played': 1548014954}
review:
Reviewing this game after playing only 1v1 multiplayer.

Pros:

- Unique civilizations

- Fast paced RTS

- Multiplayer scene active with ladder and matchmaking

Cons:

- Host advantage: This is my biggest complaint. When a ranked game starts, one of the players will be the host of the game.
This makes the non-host have higher input lag. Basically you play from the start in disadvantage. Other problem with
this is that you can see in the ranked lobby who is the host, which makes it possible to leave the lobby and not lose any ladder points. Also speaking of lobby, it could be a lot faster to get into a game by not adding aditional time for a player to choose a civ after a game is found. This choice should be made before queueing imo.

- You cant rally villagers to sheep/deer etc.

- No water maps on ladder (depite the civs having docks and boats). 

Definitely worth trying since its f2p. Still has some problems but its a game made by 3 devs. Any problem with the game join their discord since the devs are quite active there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001694883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1552410606}
review:
1vs1 y 2vs2 144 fps, 3vs3 y 4vs4 infumables, 9 fps max tengo una 970 16 de ram y un i7, no es cosa de pc, es más cosa de optimización, algo esta mal hecho con los mapas de más jugadores.

ladder de 1vs1 pero no hay ninguna ladder de teamgame? una de las primeras razones por la que juegos como age of empires II triunfa, es por lo divertidas que son las teamgames y esto tiene mucha importancia. 

creo que si arreglais estas cosas, será un juegazo... si no, pues para echar 1vs1 y algun 2vs2 no esta mal

review: Bad game for me. Very unbalanced and only rush works, defense units are garbage. Game is very fast and the only tactic that works is attack in 4 minutes moving horses. Pikes don't work. Defense is very weak. Very disappointed with games mechanics. I don't understand how has been released this fast food garbage by sliltherine with marvelous games like close combat with good time action mechanics, this crazy fast paced unbalanced it's not fun. This is not age of empires 2 like, is more like age of empires online multiplayer crap but worse. You are advise. To finish, a good song music is ruined with poors and nonexistent game sounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001861572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1522921274}
review:
Damn, they really messed up with this one.

First, lets talk about the technical aspect. It's terrible. Bad pathfinding, unplayable framerates, regular crashes. The A.I. is the worst, regardless of the focus on multiplayer.

Gameplay wise, this is a decent but extremely predictable formula. It basically feels like a AOE II-clone, but one that was made by a few youngsters in their garage rather than by a full team of RTS veterans. Except for the very interesting take on the different factions (which I'd say is the one real positive point), everything feels like the lesser version of an old classic.

Finally, the most surprising thing is how bad the graphics are. Although they look great at first, functionally they are worthless. Put any mix of units together and they will visually start blending in together, making it very hard to see which is which. This becomes a real problem once you try to micro manage your unit types against the enemy.

In summary: an honest but failed attempt to update Real Time Strategy, a technical disaster, and a work full of rookie mistakes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263844250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1539951367}
review: 很有想法的游戏，结合帝国时代和很多RTS的优点。，希望后续能够保持更新和优化

author: {'steamid': '76561198341598506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1524890919}
review:
之前更新了1.1.4，试了两把，AI的问题明显改善了。不过这样一来优化的问题就有点凸显出来，人多的时候FPS降低了很多。1v1可能还好，但是刚刚试的一局2v2，打到20多分钟，双方几百人口大战正激烈的时候闪退了。严重影响游戏体验啊

------------------------------

玩了3小时过来写个评价。先写结论：虽然问题不少，但是值得期待。
优化算是个问题，画面默认超高、风扇转的呼呼的，FPS也有波动，开成中等之后倒是稳定了不少。
有中文很好，但是汉化还不完善，有些地方明显没用心。
游戏模式很有想法，比帝国2的（几乎）千篇一律强的多了。英雄的存在本来应该是个玩点，但是一般都要先进科技才能出，似乎还有死了就没法复活的问题？不知道是不是原来玩魔兽3的影响，总觉得这个英雄的设计很微妙。
跟AI打对战的时候不知道是什么问题，反正地中海地图，AI几乎不会造兵，只是爆农民，说几乎是因为拖上几十分钟还是会有十几个兵的（难度是困难，其他地图没试）。另外寻路做的堪比星际1的龙骑、很2，在地中海地图上问题很明显，直接点海对面的话部队根本不会绕过去，只会在岸边抽搐，于是只能shift手动绕路，这个不改善很影响游戏体验。游戏界面中的帮助最好再加一点，至少我第一把玩阿兹特克都不知道囚犯怎么用，后来才摸索出来的。另外能不能加个像星际2的F2那样的按键啊，后期到处找分散的部队很麻烦啊。
生存模式也去试了一把，结果发现地图上没有石矿，我后期修理TC都需要靠市场买石头，这个地图设计是故意这样的吗？总之我感觉很纠结。但是这个模式本身还是很有意思的，期待后续添加更多内容。
最后我想说的是，官方不来个游牧地图吗？原来帝国2除了经常打的阿拉伯3V3，最喜欢的就是游牧/陆地游牧了，强烈要求出个游牧地图啊啊啊啊啊！

author: {'steamid': '76561198022412208', 'num_games_owned': 1927, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1522665822}
review:
I didnt played much sadly, but that bit was a lot of fun. 

But i cant recommend it, since there are massive performance issues with AMD CPUs (a few people reported performance issues with Intel aswell). The moment a game starts, the FPS drop to like 8-12. 3v3 and 4v4 Matches are unplayable. In 2v2 it starts well and has FPS drops after the first few minutes in game to the point where its unplayable.
Many other Users reported similiar performance issues aswell. The Devs are currently working to fix it, but as of right now, its not. I refunded it before its to late and doesnt get fixed (you never know).

author: {'steamid': '76561198021562603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1558007872}
review:
Empires Apart is a throwback to the nostalgia of early RTS games such as Ages of Empires, Age of Mythology, Empire Earth and their ilk, yet it's been ages since an empire has been built from this formula. I think there are two things to recall before going on to this review; one, that this game is currently the promise of a finished release and not one in itself yet, and two, nostalgia is a double-edged sword when an imitation isn't the same as a rose-tinted memory.

With this in mind, there are some genuine fresh ideas - unique, fully-voiced factions with their own unit rosters and technology progression routes, some of which incorporate game-changing mechanics such as progression through combat or the Mongols' literal nomadic structures, or the currently half-baked survival mode that adds a little longevity to the offline gamer.

Content is an issue at this point of early release - some factions only have one option for simple unit types, such as the French crossbowman and although this can be upgraded, it's difficult to break the genre's mould of swarming and rushing opponents. Survival mode consists of a single map. Technology rarely strays beyond the typical "+1 attack for infantry", "villagers harvest food 20% faster", etc. and although these vary from faction to faction and remain an integral part of the machine that builds your army and economy, it's something I'd like to see improved upon.

The visuals are fine; just enough detail to be coherent whilst having enough cartoon-esque flair to convince you that it looks half-pretty doing it, yet I'm undecided as to whether this lends itself well to a historical strategy game. It certainly gives a casual vibe to the experience similar to the late AoE Online, which is merely a matter of taste.

The crying shame about all of this at the moment is the AI. Pathfinding is terrible. On island maps, irrespective of difficulty, opponents will proceed to train villagers and chop every tree down, hardwired to only construct houses and storehouses - no military mind where the sea obstructs them. Crude trickles of the same units with the odd rush, B-lining straight for your town centre without even acknowledging your own troops who are blatantly going to kill them before they get there, it ruins any illusion that you will find a challenge in singleplayer.

I have faith that the AI shall be fixed in the coming month, and I know that new content has been promised already. If that is kept, I can and will recommend this slice of your childhood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073142049', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1522733951}
review:
只体验了十几分钟就申请退款。原因是游戏质量非常劣质。
其中包括三点：
-优化差，960的显卡帧数不超过20。
-操作手感差。控制一个兵要过0.几秒才移动，像是有500的延迟一样。
-智障AI。我一个轻骑兵能砍死地方三个轻骑兵，原因只因对面在跳社会摇。
这种游戏体验已经足以让我放弃这款游戏了，给我感觉游戏的综合素质不如帝国时代II。

当然本作也有优点。
+民族差距较大，这点比帝国的大同小异要好。
+科技树完整。
+加入英雄系统，但是无奈操作手感太差，无法给人带来更好的体验。

目前来说这款游戏是不合格的，不过还是希望未来能越做越好。

author: {'steamid': '76561198068635046', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1523053808}
review:
Let's first lay out my experience with this game. I was accepted into the beta within the few weeks of development, and played when I got the chance from either university work, or other games. Being in the beta I saw first hand how responsive the devs were and how much they were actually communicating, and how easy it was to tell them something directly or ask a question. So take my word as you will, I may have a little bias, but from my point of view, the devs are working hard and they do NOT seem like the type trying to do a money grab. They are just 3 guys working their asses off trying to make the game as best they can. Onto the review.

The game is buggy, crashes, and really needs to be ironed out. Personally in my opinion release should've been delayed a little more, but deadlines are deadlines and they delayed release already. 

However, the game is still pretty fun, has good depth and a lot of potential. To anyone that thinks the game is just a shallow aoe2 clone, have not looked past the facts that the game has the same 4 resources, and a lot of the same themes and core rts ideas. The similarities kind of end there. The game is faster paced, the civs are (much) lower in quantity but made much more unique. To any 4X fans, think of the difference between civ 5 BNW vs Endless Legend. In Endless Legend there is only now 11 factions (not counting mezari who are a re-skin) compared to the 43 civilizations in civ 5 BNW. However, in civ 5 all the civs are basically the same, aside from unique minor bonuses and 2 unique units or 1 unique unit and a unique building/tile. However, in Endless Legend each faction is incredibly unique with access to different technologies, passive bonuses and debuffs, completely unique units, and play style. One faction litterally does not use food resources and instead uses dust (gold/currency) to create population and just prefers desert territories. Another faction has the ability to force peace/alliance with any other player and stop wars whenever they want, except with the one faction that when they declare war, its PERMANENT war (they instead enter a truce for a certain number of turns). The differences and uniqueness of the different factions/civs in Endless Legend make the differences in Civ 5 civs negligable, and not feel that impactful. Their isn't much difference between playing French or China. And it's the same in Empires Apart.

You have 6 civs currently.
-Byzantians, a civ that has STRONG infantry and revolves around a stun on hit mechanic. They also have strong siege and and different ways to access increasing efficiencies of villagers through the mill, or their priests that give auras that buff gather rates. 

-French, a civ that has decent towers and strong cavalry and want to take the game late to get their t3 heavy cavalry unit, the Paladins. Their units, however, have good strength throughout the game because their cavalry has  a charge mechanic that gives them (splash) damage to the first hit after moving for long times (building momentum). Their priests give a blessing buff to units.

-Chinese, a defensive and slightly more complicated civ with strong archers and kung fu warriror monks for priests. The monks can also be utilized for their healing aura while stationary as it can be used to heal villagers under the Overseer effect which increases gathering amounts in exchange for damaging the villager units. They also have flamethrowers and other shnanigans.

-Arabs, probably the latest civ in the game. They have decent upgrades to everything all around, and have naft throwers, an aoe ranged unit that are very useful. Universities allow the ability to have strong stats on all units if used correctly. They also have special assassin units, that are invisble, can break invisiblity when a certain distance from enemies, and when they break the invisiblity will have temporary "i-frames" and their next attack will kill the target and if will cause an aoe slow around the area. 

-Aztecs, an early game rush civ that focus on early map control and aggression. Instead of their units upgrading through buildings and spending resources for global unit promotions, units have experience and gain promotions from engaging in combat. This lets Aztes to have high promotion units very early, which they need as they have no cavalry or siege so they need that early aggression win. They are also able to capture enemy units instead of killing them and sacrafice them for bonuses, and their priests are capable of applying an aoe curse that slows enemies.

-Mongols, the other early game rush civ. Unlike the Aztecs that have 0 cavalry, all mongol units outside of villagers are mounted. They also have special units that transform into their buildings instead of building them, and this lets them disassemble buildings and move them into new spots that allows mongols to be nomadic in nature. They have the smallest tech tree but make up for it with early game activity and aggression. Very easy and fun civ to play. 

This uniqueness in civs allows for interesting play and interactions and depth (something that other reviews seem to say this game lacks). This game has it's rough edges, lots of it honestly. But the game is fun and has heart, and the devs really want to make a good game. Most of the bad decisions (price, launch date) were most likely the publishers, so if this game is screwed more likely their fault than the devs. But the game has potential and I think If people get the game and support the game it can grow into something beautiful.

However, I am not going to tell you to buy this game. This game is overpriced, has issues, and not a good release. I recommened this game to whoever is willing to take a bet on the game, otherwise I won't try and decieve you into purchasing a product that I probably would have looked over in dissapointment if I were not in the beta, no matter how short it was. That's all I have to say about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146821397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1631127642}
review:
堪称智障的寻路ai，迷之物理碰撞，迷之远程追踪，迷之敌人难度（中等敌人比困难敌人更会暴兵？），迷之操作手感，迷之掉帧，汉化不完全，没有剧情战役。至于挑战，制作组自己玩过没有？配合着之前的种种缺点能把玩家气死。
总而言之，这就是一部半成品，虽然画风比较讨喜，但是其他的需要改进的真的有很多，根本不值这个价格，不推荐现在入手。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047262466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1523038504}
review: Frankly speaking the game is not ready for broad people mass, it's beta. Only one tutorial...  only for France... hm what about others? Please make night switchable in settings, because it's so dark, I can't play because of low light. Translation is bad too...I prefer English because my native translation very bad...And name of building, what a fuck guys? I have to see title like big word MARKET, but actually i see "some word that means market  in French language"  or instead of "warehouse" on russian i see the VERB "собрать"(to gather) are you ask pirates make this transaltion???  Oh so much work to do... But nice attempt! I believe that you can make this game great! Just do it! and listen your players!

review: I tried to get in on the beta for this and was denied several times. Maybe after some updates the game will polished enough to be worth the 30 dollar price tag but tbh In it's current state I'd maybe pay between 10 and 15 dollars. I hate to be that guy but right now Age of empires 2 HD is far superior to this in just about every way, and with new RTS games on the horizon (Age 4, Iron Harvest, Stronghold 4.. etc) unless this game is updated or discounted it will be left behind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017593746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1647624704}
review: Es una pena que un juego que podría ser la nueva era de age of empires y la estrategia de ese estilo, y que podría dar tanto juego en multijugador tenga tantos fallos. En cuanto a la jugabilidad, que aunque mejora los accesos rapidos y otros aspectos, falla en cosas tan básicas como la seleccion de unidades. En cuanto al multijugador casi todas las partidas se caen. Aunque ambicioso, desde un punto de vista técnico le falta desarrollo. No se puede construir la casa por el tejado como se suele decir. Cómo voy a disfrutar del resto si no puedo seleccionar unidades bien o jugar con los demás.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028778847', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1521887247}
review:
"Если вы не знакомы с жанром RTS, наша игра как раз для этого подходит", - так говорят разработчики и соглашусь с этим!
Классическая стратегия в реальном времени в новой обертке. Считаю, что разработчикам удалось воссоздать атмосферу того же AoE. 
Даже некоторые улучшения и исследования войск и технологий показались как-то логичнее расположены. 

Геймплей и некоторые особенности можно подчеркнуть из видео:

https://youtu.be/6r5XkAFAWVs

author: {'steamid': '76561198259218875', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1522408659}
review:
Дамы и господа. Браво какой пустяк, вышла очередная игра,
стратегия, реал тайм, только потенциал иссяк.
Да есть конечно схожести, с миром Начала империй,
Но мне, геймеру из прошлого, казаки в душу больше заели.
Там армии были, до восьми тысяч на карте солдат,
Бои, перестрелки, компании, без единого лага, восемнадцать лет назад.
Прошли эти годы, да, Путин у власти, и, вроде бы ничего не изменилось,
Но это в политике, играми люди заелись, разработчики делать их научились.
Ладно, это все взрывы из прошлого, что же нам предлагает игра?
Да в общей сложности, без ложной скромности, ну не хрена.
Компании нет, есть лишь несколько стран в режиме сражения,
Режим выживания, сетевая игра, для тех кто впервые не предусмотрено обученье.
Так ладно, что там с гемплеем? Скучно? Ресурсы, крестьяне, лучники, снова?
Повтор за повтором, война сегодня будет? А вот пришел чей-то воин.
Разведка, понятно, отвечаем аналогичными мерами,
Отсылаем посла без коня, потому что на конюшню у нас не хватает дерево.
Так, вы серьезно? Пять человек на меня нападают? Потом еще пять?
Не проще ли сразу отправить всю армию, ну может для начала собрать?
Хотя нет, это видимо целеноправленный спад демографии населения,
Отправить немного сюда, немного туда - из-за голода насильное истребление.
Постойте, но люди совсем же тут не едят, дома не нужно поддерживать деревом,
Такое чувство, что меня хотят наебать, или уже наебали в стиме зеленью..
Остановитесь, хотя, при гемплее в пять фпс, игра и так словно стоит,
Двадцать первый век, опять вспоминую восемь тысяч и первые Казаки.
Графика может тут так шикарна, что при минимальном наборе солдат,
Сердце так замирает, что фпс проседает, Калаш мне в зад.
Отлично, я буду краток, без лишних слов и предисловий, прямо скажу,
Идите нахуй товарищи разработчики, ебал я в рот играть в эту х...ню.

Не стал делать видеообзор, ибо это было бы слайдшоу, поэтому просто посмотрите мой ролик, да поставьте лайк:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0Af3CJMQCY&t=1s

author: {'steamid': '76561198082350239', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1561176191}
review:

Few maps but new ones could be great
Challenges Are Enjoyable But Few But More Factions Could Do The Thing For This One Too
Beside The Challenges An ''Real'' Campaign would be great
And FPS Issues (sadly) :(

But I Think You Guys Can Handle Those :)
And I Will Wait For The See The Game Improve :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029874230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1522578999}
review:
Unfortunately a disappointment.

Reviewing Skirmish option
1)	Game rules on any game are:
a.	Game Mode (4 options)
b.	Map (7 different map styles)
c.	Map size (4 options)
d.	Pop cap (3 options)
e.	Visibility (3 option)

In my opinion is this is even less than basic. I miss a lot of options that are possible in almost all RTS games. 

2)	I can’t really see the difference between villagers and military men and I don’t have bad eyes. 
3)	I miss a lot of in game options.
a.	Your allies are always the same color (no options to disable this)
b.	No option to see how many villagers are on a particular job
c.	No in game score option
d.	Can’t see what you need for next age (only when you already reached the target)

4)	Movement and fighting of military men is really chaotic.
5)	The AI is really bad…. on hard they only target villagers, therefore they are easy to defeat. 
6)	The AI is really bad… I build a wall with a gate and the enemy just walked back and forth, with the opening and closing of the gate (with the gate on automatic), until they died, without even attacking anything. That was the moment I quitted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119361417', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1605156662}
review: I love this game, its good fun especially for those of you who loved the old age of empires. However, there are things than need ironing out. For example the Mongols, they are my favorite civ but i feel like their cavalry is a little underwhelming, especially agaisnt top tier French and Arabic cav. I think the Mongol cav as a whole might need some tweaking to make them a bit more powerful. there are also a few glitches and the AI can be dodgy. but if you can get past these you will have a great time with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341741096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1522459009}
review:
아 ai가 너무 심각하게 안좋아요...
난이도 어려움으로 맞추고 게임했더니 적 ai가 건물 몇채 짓고 일꾼만 한 30~40명 뽑고는 가만히 있고.... 
이게 뭐야 장난하는것도 아니고 멀티도 사람이 없고...
게임 자체는 그리 나쁜 게임은 아닌데 ai가 불량(생각보다 더욱 심각)이라 싱글도 안되고 사람이 없어서 멀티도 안되고
(봐서는 평가도 점점 떨어지고 사람 유입이 안될걸로 보이니 그냥 망겜 확정)
이 게임을 살 이유가 없어요. 게임이 안돌아가는데.. 그냥 라이브러리를 장식하는 글자를... 2~3만원 주고 사는거
전 다행히 1시간 정도 게임해서 환불하네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999354867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1341, 'last_played': 1633668328}
review: This game is a love letter to RTS games of the 1990s and the early 2000s. The art style and the unique civs are great, and I can't wait to see if there is more content that will be added. Only issue is the lack of a singleplayer campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004317596', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1522511438}
review:
사실 게임 자체는 제법 마음에 듦. AOE랑 대단히 비슷하긴 한데, 티어 올리는 거나 진영별 차이를 두는 시스템이 블리자드 RTS나 제너럴 이후의 C&C 시리즈랑 비슷했음. 이런 컨셉은 상당히 좋았다. 사운드트랙도 상당히 마음에 듦.

그러나 빈약한 AI와 최적화 문제가 심각하다. 
유닛들이 길을 못 찾고 프레임드랍이 상당히 심함, 이건 RTS하면서 겪을 수 있는 것 중 최악의 문제다.

그래서 현재로서는 이 게임을 추천하기 어려움. 패치로 이런 문제를 해결해줬으면 좋겠는데... 
문제는 그 때 플레이어베이스가 빠져버리면 그거대로 (대단히 큰) 문제라는 것임.

여러모로 안타깝다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076727891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1522510920}
review:
Básicamente han vendido una beta a la que le falta mucho por pulir. 

El apartado gráfico es regular como mucho.  Las unidades son difíciles de diferenciar entre sí. Cuando juegas con otros equipos, no hay nada visual que te ayude a diferenciar tus unidades de las de tus compañeros de equipo. Hace falta pulir un poco más la física de las batallas y de los movimientos. La IA es bastante malilla. Varias unidades , como los carros de mercaderes y los sacerdotes se me quedaron trabados cuando no había ningún obstáculo o uno mínimo (por ejemplo, pasar al lado de un edificio)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989084563', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1528549847}
review: I think this is a fantastic game thus far.  It needs more content -- more map variations, a campaign, and better AI.  The AI is definitely the worst part of the game, but there's so much that they got right.  The races are more different than in AoE2, the map is easy to read at a glance (minimap and playing field) and even though this isn't my style of graphics, it looks good.  The sound effects are a little weak, but that's not a major concern.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone that is a fan of classic RTS -- it really does capture almost all of the fun of the olden tymes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078208697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1522508016}
review:
Ich hab mich sehr gefreut, dass endlich wieder einmal ein AoE-ähnliches Spiel rauskommt - und dies auch nicht als EA Titel. Allerdings hatte ich anfangs aufgrund der Desynchronisation das Problem, dass ich nicht online mit meinem Freund spielen konnte. Dann haben wir uns gedacht ok, warten wir ein bisschen. Dies wurde nun gefixt, allerdings hat er nun trotz eines starken PCs FPS Schwierigkeiten. Obwohl wir ein Spiel frisch starten und noch nicht einmal viele Einheiten und Gebäude und auch nur mit 2-3 KIs gespielt hatten, kam er maximal auf 10 FPS - sprich unspielbar. Wenn er ein Spiel eröffnet, fliege ich auch einfach raus und wenn ich mich nochmals verbinden möchte, kommt wieder die Desynchronisation und es tut sich nichts mehr. Auch bleibt es oft einfach nur hängen, sodass ich es nur über den Taskmanager schließen kann. Und wie ihr sehen könnt, habe ich noch nicht einmal 2 Spielstunden und trotzdem diese Probleme in so kurzer Zeit. 

Das Spiel hat für mich somit einen EA Status. Auch was die Einstellungen angeht, ist es meiner Meinung nach ein EA Game (zB keine LAN Möglichkeit, bei Multiplayer Lobby kann man kein privates Game einstellen, es gibt sehr wenig Karten, Tiere buggen im Kreis rum usw). Der Aktionspreis 23 Euro statt 28 ist zwar nicht so viel, allerdings erwartet man sich viel mehr von einem Spiel, welches nicht im EA Status erschienen ist. 

Somit kann ich es zur Zeit nicht empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023031707', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1522496449}
review:
制作组试图做一个改进版的帝国时代2，必须承认的是，他们确实挺有想法，改进的思路我也很喜欢，但是目前这个作品并不算是一个合格能玩的游戏，游戏体验简直令人难以忍受。尽管退款了，我还是会持续地关注，如果制作组能做出改进，我仍然愿意买回来。

+复制并改进了帝国时代2的成功模式。
+将科技升级分为经济军事两方面，给了玩家更多博弈选择空间。
+加入英雄，增加了战斗过程中的操作乐趣。
+文明压缩为6个，彼此差别增加，乐趣当然也增加了。

-优化差。卡通画风还让显卡转的飞起实在是过分
-操作性差。手感不要说对比星际争霸2了，还不如帝国时代2
-AI智障，寻路各种卡住。AI对手更是搞笑
-没有战役
-生存模式由于智障的AI，毫无乐趣
-挑战模式某些关卡设计有bug。怀疑制作组压根没自己试玩过。中国挑战里面好几个都因为弩手射程太长，一开局就射中对方，然后直接就冲过来，压根没时间做任何布置。别跟我说微操，这破手感怎么操作？

由于游戏体验太差，我压根没敢尝试多人，再尝试就退不了款了

author: {'steamid': '76561198031498452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1635699150}
review:
Grundsätzlich sicher kein schlechtes RTS 

Was mir jedoch nicht gefällt:
- "matschige" Grafik/Farben
-  sehr schlechte Zoom-Level; weit herauszoomen fehlt!
-  kein Tutorial, das die speziellen Unterschiede der Völker erklärt
-  Ruckelt, wenn viele Einheiten da sind
- Viel zu wenig Karten
- Single-Player Kampagne fehlt

Dafür ist der Preis momentan viel zu hoch!
Meiner Meinung nach ist das Ganze noch "Early Access-Niveau"
10 bis max. 15 Euro wären  angemessen.
Schade.
Aber vielleicht wird es noch verbessert???

Dezember 2018
Nein, es hat sich nicht verbessert.
Statt dessen der übliche Mist mit Zusatzkosten.
Nein, das ist Abzocke. Mit mir nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981516047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1541155016}
review: El juego es estupendo. Todo lo que esperaba de él. Un más que digno sucesor de la saga Age of Empires. La música es sobresaliente. Los pequeños fallos de la IA y el pathfinding que tenía la beta (por algo era beta) han sido mejorados. El multijugador lo mejor. Divertidísimo. ¡Lo recomiendo!

review:
I literary have been waiting for something similar to appear for at least ten years. I cannot understand many of the negative reviews that game has got , especially it is only out since two days. But most of those proably do not understand what major disappoitments  for example Empire Earth III, Planetary Anihilation and Dawn of war III have been. 

So far I have played it is solid and engageing at least for me.

It is played so far like AoE II but has an even faster speed ( I am used to 6+ hour marathons ine Empire Earth /3+ in AoE since there building material will be long gone/)
The differences between the empires are major while the classic rock paper scissors mechanic is still in play.
But the build order for the nations varies greatly.

There will be a lot which has to be edited and added but I think that I have to get the word out that it is good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054398948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1522992354}
review:
I will admit it is a bit difficult to recommend the game in its current state with a $30 price tag. And especially if you are not the kind of person that enjoys multiplayer and likes to queue up against AIs and nothing else, this is DEFINTELY not the game for you at all.
However, if you enjoy multiplayer, quick in-depth gameplay, and a ranked experience that doesn't require hours of Lobby Simulator 2018, then this is a title you can probably get a good deal of enjoyment out of.

All that said, from a game design perspective this game does a great job in my mind. It borrows and builds upon the old-school RTS model quite well-- although its choice of time period easily lends it to the "ripoff" label that I do not think it fully deserves. Functionally however, the game is missing a number of quality-of-life features and a level of polish that one might come to expect in an RTS. But as much as I resent the strategy of releasing games seemingly unfinished-- the developers seem very committed to improving the game. (For instance a balance/bug patch was pushed almost immediately after release when imbalance/desyncs were discovered.)

Subjectively I think the art style is quite nice and not nearly as distracting as many make it out to be, though many of the models are still far from perfect in my opinion.

Everything taken into consideration along with the commitment the small 3 man development team is showing toward the community's concerns, I'd say EA has a good potential for a strong future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070723910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3457, 'last_played': 1582927948}
review:
Empires Apart is an indie title made by a small team, it is heavily inspired by Age of Empires 2 in units and theming, it's really good at what it does and an amazing amount of fun. I've never been much of a multiplayer person, but this title had me hooked since I entered beta. A few things are good to note about the design:

The pacing was designed to be fast without loss of strategic depth, which means streamlined. Most matches can be finished in 20-30 minutes. There is very little dead space or PvE (player versus environment) play at the start of a match, and not even beginners should feel like they need to jump through hoops with set build orders and such or like they'd rather play with rules like "no attacking for the first hour". Everything from gather rates and resource balance to map size and the availability of units and more town centers is very well tought out for what style of game Empires Apart wants to be. The scout can scan the environment in two long strokes, then scout the enemy or lure boar. Every task you think of is streamlined and quick, no chores that keep you from playing the rest of the game for half a minute. And when I said "no loss of strategic debt" up there I meant it. For optimal play you need to decide within the first two or three villagers you make whether you're emphasizing rush or boom, and start working towards the first big military or economy upgrade.

Empires apart was designed from the ground up to be intuitive. For instance: the anti-cavalry bonus is called "long weapon", and that's how you visually recognize all the units that have it. That bonus works on all mounted units. And now you know what you needed to know about that. If you can gather infantry in a building, you can gather cavalry there, if you can hand in fish at a dock you can hand in berries and wood and gold, no matter who or what killed an animal you can gather food from it. The game was made as intuitive as possible to pick up and start to play, even for those new to the genre.

Traditionally there are two ways to make a balanced multiplayer game: having two, three or maybe four completely unique civs, or having as many civs as you like that are very similar. Empires Apart embraces the age of patches to allow a degree of civ/faction uniqueness in between those two, dunking us into unexplored territory and some awesome matchups. This means that the game will keep getting balance patches for the forseeable future, since this kind of balance is inherently really hard to get right.

Empires apart was designed with all the conveniences of a modern RTS. Automatic farm reseeding, command queue, a clever control group system that allows you to run unit production quickly in between other tasks, ranked play on a ladder with matchmaking function, good HUD/UI. There is very little about this game to get frustrated about (other than an opponent who's playing just that little bit better than you of course).

Lesser sides: The single player options are bells and whistles. Fun, but not nearly as fun as the multiplayer. The short single player challenges are pretty good at teaching you the few tricks you won't pick up by yourself though, and complement the intuitive gameplay. The AI is aimed mostly at beginners, although it's scheduled to keep improving. The balance as mentioned before is not optimal yet. Plus the game has heroes. They're wel done and fit the rest of the game, but I'm just not a fan of heroes in general.

Overall though it's just a really fun title where you can jump into an all out war and be done in time for dinner. The great easily outweighs the "meh".

author: {'steamid': '76561197995311943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1521004519}
review: tl;dr Empires Apart is a spiritual successor to Age of Empires: with no singleplayer content and a predictable, cliched multiplayer experience, and it's difficult to recommend Empires Apart at its price point. If you are an absolute die-hard RTS and Age of Empires fan, pick this game up, but anybody else should get it during a heavy sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994788532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1628630253}
review:
Игра вроде как неплохая, не смотря на графику не сильно красивую, мне понравилось в этой игре уникальность наций, во всяком случае визуальная уникальность, каждый юнит имеет своё название, внешний вид, поиграв за франков, понял что у них сильная кавалерия, слабая пехота, стрелки арбалетчики, есть очень сильные всвдники - тамплиеры у них есть полоска  защиты, только после того как собьётся эта полоска защиты, только потом начнёт убывать хп жизни, восстанавливают эту полоску обычные франкские мечники, они наверно типа оруженосцев, хп жизнь можно восстановить только в гарнизоне крепости это всем, пехота может в городском центре.
Поиграв за Монголов, пеших воинов нету вообще, только конные ближнего боя и дальнего, тяжёлого типа и лёгкого, накапливают силу когда воюют, проблема Монголов что нету ферм, еду добывать только с кустов или охотой, как дальше без еды хз, все здания можно перемещать.
У меня получилась главная проблема игры - это оптимизация, на карте 2х2 я один против компьютера среднего, у меня тормозило ппц, этакая плавающая стратегия, в итоге несмотря на то что она мне понравилась, я её здал назад и получил обратно деньги. К примеру новая Age of Empires DE с классной графикой в отличие от Empires Apart, вообще нету ни каких тормозов, в одиночной и в мультиплеере с людьми, это называется хорошая оптимизация.
В общем у кого компы хорошие можете брать, если вы фанаты АоЕ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048101201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1526703616}
review:
This is a game that takes the Age of Empires gameplay we know and love and builds on it in small but fun and thoughtful ways. It's incredibly refreshing to see an RTS made that isn't trying to recapture the MOBA audience, and it's even more heartening to see the clear love for old-school RTS gameplay the developers are working from. In the early days after launch there have been issues - some serious performance problems on large maps and some occasional pathfinding goofs - but I'm already really enjoying the game as I'm able to play it, and the developers seem active and are working towards improving it; they've already released a few small patches that fixed one or two issues I was seeing.

There are tons of small conveniences in the UI that feel like they were designed by people who played and thought about AoE2 - markets and farms are handled much more elegantly, there's a button for grabbing your wounded units, there are better visualizations of control groups and idle villagers... a lot of small changes have been made to the familiar formula with the goal of improving quality of life, and for the most part it's been great!

The biggest difference between this and an old Age game is how unique each of the civilizations are. I've mostly been playing as Aztecs and Chinese so far, and each civ has unique mechanics and tech trees and units that make them feel like properly different experiences. I love the Aztec prisoner-taking mechanic in particular - there's a special fun to raiding your enemy, turning their units into prisoners, then converting the prisoners into free villagers or sacrificing them for resources. The way Mongols build and deconstruct and move their buildings around is actually really clever, and fun to play around with.

The art style is also fun and charming in its own way, even though there are a few uneven elements to it, and the sounds and music and voices are surprisingly well-done and nicely tailored to each civilization, considering this is very much a small, low-budget project.

No, I don't love every design choice - I think walls could stand to be more imaginative, I'm lukewarm on the day/night cycle, and a few of the units look a bit too similar to one another at a glance. But this is a valiant effort that has resulted in a fun game, and I want to see development continued and maybe even expanded upon. It could be something truly special, especially if it sees enough success for the devs to keep working on it for months or years to come.

That's why I'm rather unusually reviewing the game before I've really had my fill of it - traditional RTS games are an endangered species, and since I've really enjoyed my first few games (I was definitely worried it would be too janky before I actually played it), I wanted to throw a good review out there early to encourage people to try it and to encourage the devs to keep working on it. Once I've played all of the civs and modes more extensively, and once it's been patched a bit, I'll try to remember to update this review with some more precise thoughts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004815718', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1546223711}
review:
Game is very solid. Some pros:

* The presentation is fantastic. UI, music and graphics are really polished. There are some caveats, for instance some units look very similar to each other so they could use some polish, and some UI elements are in odd places or have odd symbols so they need to be polished as well.
* Performance on my machine is fantastic, no surprises there. 
* Skirmish mode and challenge modes work well. The AI is relatively challenging at the harder levels and everything works as expected.
* Multiplayer is really snappy and I've had no issues with lag. Extremely hard against some players however. It looks like people have already figured out ways to cheese other players in 1v1 matches such as stealing your sheep and instantly killing them so their food goes to waste.

The game shipped at launch with (six? civs), plenty of single player modes and four multiplayer modes. No campaign but I mean, they never said they were gonna make that..? So idk why people are complaining.

Cons:

* The basic unit management AI needs some work. I've left some forum posts regarding some changes that need to be made to make the AI more intuitive.
* In general, all of the AI needs work. The enemy is pretty easy to steamroll and kite and usually they waste a lot of units by sending small amounts of units constantly to the enemy base. They also waste a lot of resources by building town centers at the enemy base and then not cancelling them so it becomes easy to cheese them in the late game.

I really enjoy the game, I think it needs some polish but for the most part I'd say it's a very successful release. Way better than the shit fest that was Grey Goo. Good job DESTINYbit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025571627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1564984543}
review:
This game is one of the most interesting and beautiful ideas I have seen in a long time. The potential for this title is amazing and I hope that the developers are able to bring it to where it needs to be. 

But in all likely hood it will never get there.

Many People have complained about the single player, but the games focus says it is competitive multiplayer, so I will be discussing on that and tell you why I can’t recommend this amazing game.

Its relatively simple, there are 3 problems that will prevent this game from getting off the ground.

1) First it released in a very poor state (not in early access) which turned many people off from the game and stalled the player base, if you play a 2v2 and it gets to late game the game will crash. Which is a real shame as the 2v2 and higher has real potential if they turned it into something that was not just a simple as a LOL like team selection at the start that has no real effect.

But let’s say they do change it to something more interesting and unique mode that separates it from the other RTS games you then run into the second problem

2) There is one competitive mode which is 1v1, so all the higher player modes don’t mean anything because if you want to be ranked there is as I said only 1v1. But as of this moment there are at a peak around 200 players for this game, which means not only is the base extremely small which will create large que times, but there are many players which I have faced that clearly have played the beta for some time which leads to HUGE disparities in game understanding and you will lose A LOT when you are trying to understand the game. 

Now for me I am fine with facing stronger opponents if makes for an interesting challenge.  The majority of players however will be completely turned off by that and with an extreme lack of AI and almost no hosted custom games you really don’t have many options.

 This brings us to the final problem

3) For a game based on history it is only appropriate to point out that past games that begin this poorly are normally abandoned. The reason is simply, this is a gaming company and no matter how passionate their developers are, if their player base is small and they can’t get it grow they will be losing money on a product. And like any other business you can’t function if you don’t get income from your products or you don’t have the reserves to fund a failing project in a hope that one day it takes off. With Age of Empires 4 and other RTS games coming not to mention games like North Guard and They are Billions that are currently out, very functional, and have a very different approach to the RTS style, it is difficult to see any other outcome than the forced abandonment of this game.

I hope I am wrong, that I can look back in weeks, months or even a year, take down my review and preach to all to go out and buy this game. But with a need for bug fixes and increase single player content , better AI, a purposefully 2v2 and higher mode, bigger player base, Inability to host private games, in game mechanical fixes with pathing, balancing, game stability, and a need for the game to make a name for its self in a different way outside of "a competitive  RTS", based on past games I can’t see a way for this game to recover and become the game I wish it could be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022409841', 'num_games_owned': 1343, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1522427982}
review:
Really unimpressed with this game. 

I'm a huge fan of RTS games, Age of Empires and Age of Mythology especially. While Empires Apart definitely borrows heavily from these games, it feels like a bare-bones recreation rather than something trying to build off the genre's past success.

I might be able to look past the game's poor performance, odd UI, baffling controls/hotkeys, lackluster AI, and overall lack of polish if there was something special underneath. But all that's there is a bland game which looks to appeal to RTS newcomers in the laziest way possible. There is also no meaningful single-player content, despite the game not being mechanically deep enough nor contain a sufficient amount of content to rely solely on multi-player skirmishes to carry it.

Empires Apart tries to do almost nothing new to set itself apart, and doesn't streamline the RTS genre in a satisfying enough way to be novel. I cannot in any way recommend you pick up this game, and I'm not sure if any amount of patching or future updates can fix the problems I have with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967419253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1522410970}
review:
Doesnt do enough to set itself apart.

The devs have set themselves a pretty high bar to beat, people have been crying out for an RTS style game that brings back the good old days of AOE and this has such familiarity (even in the name) to it that you can step into the game almost immediately and find yourself back in the 90s, but this is where it makes you pause.   

It is ultimately a multiplayer game, again exactly what was offered but Im not completely sold on the idea that there is anything new here and thats my problem..  my expectations started of as 'great an AOE inspired game' and I ended up with the thought  'oh it is just AOE'... and funnily enough seen that done that.... 

I went into the skirmish mode to give myself a refresher and got smashed by the AI on medium, I know the devs have said that the AI is very efficient at managing resources but in the time I had built 3 houses, a stable and launched villagers, the ai was already sending waves of 5 or six troops to attack.. and when I did eventually get 10 units up the AI had something like 20 or 30 plus villagers.. and just blobbed, this will ultimately be the same strategy in multiplayer .

 On easy it literally did the same thing but I was able to take out its buildings in time.  Annoyingly with the AI villagers would stand around with arm full of resources and do nothing, and soldiers at times would let enemy waltz their way past without batting an eyelid, even garrisoning the villagers, all they did was to go to the building and hang around outside with their arms crossed like they were mildly cross at waiting in a toilet queue,  whilst getting lumps knocked out of them by enemy soldiers.   Scouting is painful, there is no auto scout and more often than not I completely forgot that I had sent my scout off across the other side of the map.    

Of course there is no substitute for multiplayer game play but if this is not EA and im looking at 6 factions, its quickly going to become pretty 1 dimensional.  I do hope there is no pay for DLC in this i.e adding other factions.     The fact is that he who rushes wins ... 

So if you want AOE inspired game this is it literally, its AOE, but if you were actually looking for more single player/AI this is not it... if you want AOE multiplayer then this will fill that empty hole .

author: {'steamid': '76561198311629832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1526521529}
review:
As an Age of Empires II fan myself, I couldn't resist but compare this game to AOE II. I've made a well-edited video where I list all the differences I could spot. Hopefully it will give you an idea on what to expect from this game:

https://youtu.be/ZifLNfSIE4A

If you don't know AOE II, then here is a brief list of pros and cons:

- Pros:
1. Nice Graphics
2. Smooth gameplay
3. Multiplayer is alive and it takes about 7 seconds to find a ranked room
4. Lots of useful tools such as automated farm reseeding, etc
5. Six different nations, each of which features truly unique gameplay and even unique soundtracks
6. Decent balance despite the variety of units and unique abilities
7. In brief, the game looks and feels good

- Cons:
1. No campaign
2. Tutorial is short and it might be challenging for a newcomer to learn all of the things they need to be good at the game
3. Requires quite a beefy PC (will NOT work on a PC/laptop without a dedicated GPU)
4. Just like in AOE II and most RTS games, multiplayer latency depends on the host. There are no dedicated game servers, which is not an issue usually, though sometimes it can get a bit challenging to deal with the lag

In brief:
Would I recommend you this game? If you are an AOE II fan, then sure. It is totally worth a try. I wouldn't recommend you this if you are totally new to RTS because it's quite challenging for now. Otherwise, it's a decent game and I'd say, if you've got the money, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065664411', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1522400834}
review:
We should not forget that RTS fans have high standards. Not only do they want a fantastic singleplay campaign, they also want a "perfect" balance in multiplay. But both don't matter much to me. Campaigns are not so important to me because I play RTS mainly in multiplay. At the same time, I also understand that it is almost impossible to have a "perfect" balance in multiplay.

So why am I going to give this game the thumbs-down? I just wanted something basic. The UI of this game is bizarre. You can't set a rally point to animals to gather food. It's possible to automine any other resources such like gold, stone, tree by setting a rally point, but You can't set a rally point to animals including livestock like sheeps. Why is it impossible to automine food only while other resources may be able to be automined? That's pretty inconsistant.

One more thing about the UI. When you place a mouse cursor over a unit's icons, it is expected to see their meanings. For example, when you select a Chinese Qingqibing(it's a light cavalry unit of China faction) and place a mouse cursor over its icons, you may assume somehow that "the axe 4" is its attack value, "the shoes 360" are its speed value though there aren't any explanations. But it is pretty hard to assume the difference between "the normal shield 0" and "the broken shield 2". I know there is the saddle icon explaining "Vulnerable to Long Weapon", but it's not enough. They really need to add more explanations.

As a RTS fan, I really wanted to give this game the thumbs-up. It is not easy to create RTS in today's age. Therefore, the developer's courage is worthy of praise. But they failed even to meet my low standard, just a normal UI.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997782035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1534775536}
review:
*Before reading: You want to play against a dumb NPC and always win with loads of unnenecesary clicking? This might be your game.

This game looked to be nice, nice concept good enough graphics and just the classical gameplay..

But pathfinding is a terrible mess. NPC get stuck in a loop doing nothing but spin around.
Resource depleted? Lets stand here while the next tree is only 1 block away.

besides that NPC's are also a joke. The NPC builds only houses and grabs gold like it got gold fever. Waited an hour for an NPC to start building something on hard dificulty.. Nothing else.

UI is buggy aswel. Was playing as the Mongols, and the UI start freaking out. After each 3 second it deselected everything I had selected. Byebye building or recruiting.

Considering it has been a long time in devolpment and has had a beta for quite some time with a price tag of 28 euros when not discounted.. Nope, not worth it.
Especially considering they don't release it as "early acces" but as a full release. This is far from a full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976259471', 'num_games_owned': 2541, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1522389493}
review: AI is pretty rough but there are very few classic style RTS games and I like that each of the factions have a distinct look. Game is a little sparse right now, like 8 maps playable as 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, or 4v4 (size wise, you can play with 2 people on an 8 person map) along with a survival mode with infinite waves. Graphics are basic but pretty good and everything has its own feel which is a good break from a lot of RTS. Recommend overall, can see the game getting to be a great strategy title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156491504', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1523219049}
review:
The game has potential. Its not much like AOE so much as in you basically just rush, all of the walls and defensive buildings in this game are useless, youll never get the chance to build them. All you do is get an army in 5 minutes and rush. 

You need a very good computer to run 4v4's on a good map. I have never had trouble running any type of game until now. 

Although my review sounds bad, this game has potential. It's not worth how much it is right now but the price might be worth it once they tweak it a bit.

review: 刚刚试玩了一下下，打完了教程，准备退款，但是看到第一条评测，决定把它留下。目前只有挑战、生存和遭遇战，但似乎还在更新，希望后面可以加入一些战役和剧情。

author: {'steamid': '76561198082720068', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1561815220}
review:
Je n'ai pas eu le temps de beaucoup jouer pour le moment mais je vais tenter de répertorier les différents atouts et défauts du jeu ! (je n'ai pas jouer en PvP)

Bon cotés :
-6 nations vraiment différentes (2 économique, 2 défensive, 2 aggressive)
-graphismes cartoon (mais c'est juste une question de gouts)
-défis de microgestion (Comme SC2)
-mode survie
-map procédurale
-AOE2 like

Mauvais cotés :
-prix beaucoup trop élevé à mon goûts
-moins de contenu qu'un AOE2 en termes d'amélioration
-pas de campagne
-pas de possibilité de faire des groupes d'unité (ou alors j'ai pas trouvé)
-IA peut être un peu faible

Personnellement je suis agréablement surpris plus complet que je ne le pensais, ne prenez pas ça pour le nouveau gros RTS du moment ça reste un petit RTS, je le conseil surtout en promo mais j'espère beaucoup des futurs mises à jours !

Conclusion, Petit RTS bien sympa !

author: {'steamid': '76561198356617675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1547605673}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024362906', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 10106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9751, 'last_played': 1679311459}

review:
*Edit*

I supported this game when they went public.  However, due to their recent news I refuse to support them anymore.

• They go free to play as a last ditch effort to try to save their dying game.

• All nations that WERE apart of the original game when it was paid for is now DLC

• Should of kept the game the way it was.  If anything, to have it lower in price.  I'd refund if I could.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060938457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1555676270}
review:
<2018.3.30일 기준>
-50% 할인 가격이면 꽤 적절한 게임.
평점 : 3/5
장점 : 의외로 정들인 그래픽 모델링(그렇다고 고증이 맞다는 건 아님. 그냥 예쁨 정도?), 
         -부담없는 아트 스타일(그렇지만 권장사양보다 약간 사양을 더 필요로 합니다.), 
         -확연하게 다른 문명간의 특징(몽골과 아즈텍을 해보면 그냥 지립니다.), 
         -간만의 올드 스타일 RTS(느립니다. 생산과 채집은 느린데 유닛은 겁나 빨리 죽습니다.)
         -개발사의 패치 의지가 확고함.(원래는 더 있다가 출시하고 싶어했으나, 향후 패치로 밸런스를 잡는 쪽으로 변경.)

단점 : -멍청한 AI(길 찾기가 약간 멍청합니다. 근데 자동 공격은 또 기가차게 합니다. 개발사의 지속적인 패치로 업데이트 예정.), 
         -부족한 테크트리(AoE2 절반도 못 미침, 아직 개발사의 언급이 없어서 모르겠습니다.),
         -부족한 문명 수(DLC를 통해서 추가된다고 함.) ,
         10%부족한 한글화(출시시간을 미뤄가면서 해준 한글화. 패치를 통해서 완벽하게 지원할 예정이라고 함.)

사견 : 일단 그래픽에 반해서 도키, 고대 문명이 나와서 도키, 도합 도키도키했던 게임입니다. 
올드 RTS를 말하는 만큼 게임 속도는 느리고, 시스템은 AoE2의 시스템 80%를 가져온 듯한 게임성을 가지고 있습니다.
맵에 희귀 자원(금, 돌)은 적고, 채집과 생산이 느린 만큼 유닛 조합과 문명 특성에 맞춘 전략으로 컨트롤 해야합니다.
특히 문명에 따라서 테크트리와 사용가능한 자원이 약간씩 다른데, 아직 시나리오 모드가 없어서 문명별 사용법을 모르는 경우가 많습니다.

+프랑스는 겁나 딴딴합니다. 초반에는 타워와 성벽으로 방어 위주로 가면서 병력을 최대한 아끼고 후반의 요새 유닛 크루세이더와 보병 조합으로 모든걸 밀어버리는 컨셉입니다. 조금 비싼 유닛 비용과 부담스러운 유닛 업그레이드 수순이 있지만..  보병이 요새 유닛 방어력을 리젠 시켜준다는 점에서 한방에 훅 미는 스타일입니다. 

+비잔틴은 고루고루 강합니다. 초반에 아즈텍의 어택땅만 없으면 가면 갈수록 유리해지는 타입이 아닐까 싶네요. 스타로치면 프로토스 정도?

+아랍은 과학력위주라고 하는데, 사실 크게 티는 안납니다. 하지만 종교인과 달리 의사가 지속힐을 해주는 유닛으로  따로 있기 때문에 여러저모 독특합니다. 아즈텍과 마찬가지로 파란 자원이 있는데, 이건 시간이 지나면 자동으로 채워지는건지 특정 조건이 발생하면 채워지는 건지 모르겠지만, 하다보니 다 채워져있습니다.

+아즈텍의 파란 희생 자원은  포로를 잡은 다음 해당 건물에 넣으면 스택이 쌓여서 사용이 가능합니다.
이를 통해서 아즈텍은 깡 보병의 피통과 공속, 공성이 추가 자원없이 즉효성으로 업그레이드 가능함으로, 초반에 유일하게 보병이 식량만 먹는 이점을 이용해서 물량으로 보내서 포로를 다수 확보하는 것이 포인트입니다. 아즈텍은 막말로 나무와 식량만 있으면 세상 정복이 가능한 유일한 문명이라 볼 수이 있습니다. 홀로 철기시대로 못 넘어간 문명이라 걱정했는데, 뭉둥이로 맞아도 아픈건 아픈거다라는 것을 제대로 알려주는 문명입니다.

+중국은 원거리 깡패입니다. 초반 방어만 성공하면 압도적으로 긴 사정거리와 세상 출타 한 저격병과 연노 조합으로 적은 나를 보지도 못하는데 나는 공격하는 모습을 볼 수 있습니다. 근접전이 걱정이라구요? 걱정하지마세요. 엔지니어를 뽑으면 지뢰밭을 매설해서 근접전으로 접근 하는 적들을 날려버릴 수 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966405995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1584825767}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085228465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1522371596}
review:
I have been playing AoE2 and saw this game.

Very buggy AI, on Survival mode I was able to trick AI into simply walking back and forth and never attack due to pathfinding. Villagers also frequently get stuck on objects.
Love the graphics and style and the UI is ok.


Overall I still prefer AoE2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128359543', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1544137090}
review:
This is a complete game with minimum feature, not as people said it's incomplete. 
And even though A.I. is really not as good as other RTS but still better than Civ 6 if you ask me.

The graphic and music are medicore, the concpet of art was nice though.

The only problem I have with this game is that I cannot escape from the horrible FPS drop no matter how I tune down the setting.

And with i7 6700 and GTX 1080 I'm pretty sure the problem is not on my end...

I'll refund for now, I'll purchase it again once this lag and fps issue is fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030997975', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1522367685}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079069915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1522661096}
review:
To keep it short this is an excellent multiplayer RTS game inspired by AoE (Age of Empires) but innovating at the same time.

The one major short-coming is the lack of singleplayer (the AI is not great and really only seems to prepare you for multiplayer) so if that is what you were looking for I am afraid you should look at other games, such as AoE, Grey Goo or the upcoming Iron Harvest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071894016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1546432056}
review:
Would have recommended if it had the "Early access" tag.
It doesn't.

The game simply isn't finished.
- AI is really poor.
- pathing is cluncky
- resources are scarce and easily run out (especially on island maps.)
- town center f.e. can't give command to spawning villagers to gather meat from sheep/deer.
- commands to other resources often don't work properly either as the units get stuck on the way
- maps are very basic and uninteresting.
- the game itself is ... basicly AOE (obviously) but once you get ingame.
And you see the buildings / upgrades / resource costs / styles and interactions.
you'll realise how much this is a copy/paste of aoe with barely any new or "modern" spin to it.
in fact it either lacks things wich even "AOE the rise of rome"  had or does a worse job at it.
- optimisation ? have to run it on medium and close my "Black Desert Online" to prevent lag.
for comparison: i ran farcry 5 on max settings yesterday while running black desert in the background without an issue
- and yes after closing everything but the game. putting it on medium settings... it just crashed on me several times.

Sigh. don't feel like making the list longer than it is.
I've been trying to get into the beta for this game a long time.
Been eagerly waiting for the release.
But this.
Is sad :c

I will edit this review once they've added some patches*
So far this was my first impression.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977723316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1522360741}
review:
Overall the game lacks a lot of polish and finish. AI is terrible and spent whole game making useless buildings which it deleted randomly later on. I am currently requesting a refund. 

Some may find enjoyment with this as it is almost a reskin of Age of Empires II (so similar I am surprised they are not in trouble for blatent copying). This Despite the updated graphics, combat has very basic animations and the game is not enjoyable to look at. I am fine with the overall look of the game, but I am saying some parts and animations just do not look finished. 

Overall, I was excited and the gameplay can be enjoyable, but the game overall seems unfinished and needs some work

author: {'steamid': '76561198075545644', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1563266245}
review: Как игрок в age of empires 2 отыгравший на международной арене более 2000 каток, динамика, принцип - все закос под ту самую аое2. Баланса маловато, но играбельно в качестве свежого взгляда на старые добрые стратегии. Со стоимостью не много преувеличили. author: {'steamid': '76561198134717577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3382, 'last_played': 1557573600}
review:
中国--弩手文明，骑兵和攻城武器也都不错，打到后期一大堆诸葛连弩高射程基本横扫一切，只不过前期容易被蒙古/阿兹特克等名族吊打就目前来看因为没什么前期兵种能够有效地抗衡

法国--骑兵文明，骑兵奔跑一段路程后获得双倍攻击力，比别的名族骑兵厉害多了，经济,攻城武器也都很好，中后期特别厉害，前期的轻骑兵也能够有效地作战，个人比较喜欢。

拜占庭--你如果是玩帝国时代2的话，这个名族就是帝国时代2全科技的感觉了，没啥优缺点，步兵比较厉害，后期他国普通弩手打满科技满防的步兵基本不掉血

蒙古--游牧名族房子可以“动”，随时可以拆迁运行到下一个地点，拥有着强大的马弓手，前期十分难缠

阿兹特克--步兵+弓兵的配合的文明，兵种科技无法升级，而是通过战斗获得经验值来升级的，打野生动物/敌人都可以获得经验值，所以前期你的兵可以莫名其妙比对面高一个等级。在开启“抓捕”技能的情况下可以将杀死的单位作为俘虏，俘虏可以用来献祭到科研所提高特别给力的科技如加移速攻速/生命值等等。和蒙古一样也是前期比较难缠的名族

阿拉伯--算是最复杂的名族了，房子和房子之间是有联系的，造在“大学”附近的房子可以通过大学里面研究的科技获得兵种加成，造在“磨坊”附近的农田是会增加产量的。有着不错的科技，兵种也基本什么都有但是没什么特别突出的感觉。如果你喜欢自虐，这个名族应该很适合你！

每个名族都有英雄，多数都从城堡里面造，不过基本上所有英雄都没有太大质变，主要还是考验玩家的领兵能力，帝国时代4出来之前就玩这个了！
游戏最大的缺点目前来看就是缺乏战役，考虑到这是一款原价￥88的游戏，游戏内容还是不够丰富。但是对于多人模式竞技方面，这个游戏还是十分有乐趣的。综合来看我给7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198070600573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1522357357}

O jogo até que é bom... 
Mas está muito mal otimizado, começa com 60fps depois de algumas unidades feitas cai pra 15-20fps.
Os Bot não fazem nada, nao reagem nem produzem infantaria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031890854', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1522356760}
review:
Followed the game for a year or so, I was expecting the AI to be better than the 1999 Age of Empires AI. The AI kept standing still doing nothing, destroying buildings and rebuilding them, and others weren't even trying to compete over relics nor were some even attacking me. (And this was on hardest.)

As usual in this time of day: Graphics are awesome, gameplay not so much. 

What should've been an awesome launch resulted in me refunding the game in it's current state. Feels like a shame as I hoped to it to launch (as the teaser told) 'a new age of genre'.

EDIT: I did want to add to my fairly negative review that I was just hoping the developers would've pushed out a stable version of the game, and not in early beta stage. AI bugs this bad could've been avoided more easy than people think.

I don't accept that kind of developer behaviour, and neither shouldn't you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084944502', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1549652172}
