author: {'steamid': '76561198239512330', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1541536709}
review:
I played 12 games so far and enyoed the game a lot. 

It feels like a fresh mix of Command & Conquer and Age of Empires, is very fast, skill testing and has 6 very different civilizations. The balance is obviously not perfect yet and the art style takes some getting used to but is not that important to me.

Overall I can recommend it to every real time strategy fan looking for something new.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099589436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13042, 'last_played': 1544643121}
review:
After playing this game for almost 200 hours (Beta participant I can say the game has potential but it just has many flaws. There is no singleplayer campaign and the AI is very weak even on "hardest". The few single player challenges can be completed within 2 hours MAX if you are new to the game. 

The night in the day-night cycle is too dark. The civs are unbalanced. Some civs lack depth and so you are stuck with the same strategy over and over again. No replays available. No scenario editor. You cannot set way points of your towncenter on sheep or other living resources. Sometimes it is very hard to differentiate buildings (arab house / arab storage) and the units throughout all civs. And many other stuff that is just annoying...

The focus is clearly on Multiplayer 1 vs 1. You can get a ranked match real fast if you click on"duel". But you cannot see who your opponent is (Steam-name) and what civ he picked until you are in the game.

If you are into a broken 1 vs 1 multiplayer fun game it is ok for you. Otherwise I would suggest waiting for another game or stick to aoe2...

author: {'steamid': '76561197994880575', 'num_games_owned': 1801, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1844, 'last_played': 1618479847}

The game is fun and addictive, and combined with the nations looking and feeling different it is a super game. I do recoment it, and give it 15 asswhoopings from Adne out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055780740', 'num_games_owned': 5600, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 2568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2568, 'last_played': 1522352550}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Empires Apart is an RTS that barely gets a recommended. It is heavily inspired by Age of Empires in all the right ways, but lacks a singleplayer campaign. Without a campaign, this game is hard to recommend for its $30 price point. As for gameplay, research has been streamlined to increase the speed at which a game is played. Races are also incredibly unique, the most of any RTS I’ve played. Graphics are polygonal and sharp while staying slightly abstract. The sound design is good and every race has unique voice lines for their units. The music is orchestral and war like to hype up the player. The netcode really impressed me. I played against another player in Germany and there wasn’t any noticeable lag present. 

[h1]Game Breakdown[/h1]
[u]Gameplay:[/u]
The gameplay is typical for the RTS genre. The player must collect four different resources with peasants. These include food, gold, stone, and lumber. Lumber is key to the construction of buildings and is an important early game resource. Food is good all game as it is used to recruit units such as peasants and military units. Stone is mainly used for late game defensive structures and gold is used to buy resources and construct military units. This isn’t the case for every races as Aztecs only need food for their first military unit.

The six different races in Empires Apart are some of the most unique races I have ever played in an RTS. Every race a completely different set of mechanics for its units. For example, Aztec units gain experience while fighting which allows them to level up into a new, more powerful, form. They don’t however have any upgrades to replace the weak early game units with stronger late game units. While they do have some late game options, their mechanics require a player using the Aztecs to be constantly battling and improving their troops. This plays into the Aztec priests as they are able to heal one’s units.  To get better units for most races requires research.

The research system in this game is greatly simplified. Instead of requiring a certain amount of buildings or previous research, two types of research are available from the beginning. These are economic research and military research. Economic research allows the player to build economic research centers, and occasionally unique buildings such as Arabian universities, that provide resource collection buff to peasants. Military research in turn provides new military buildings, unit upgrades and defensive options, like stone walls, to the player’s build menus. By simplifying the research and making it available from the beginning, games are much faster and only take about 20 to 25 minutes each. Besides battling with typical military units, heroes are also added to the mix. 

Heroes are extremely late game units that can turn the tide of the gmae. Each race has both a warrior hero who participates in battle, and a ruler hero, who gives buildings and workers various bonuses. Some of the warriors have an aura such as the Mongols Chinggis Khaan who empowers the bloodlust abilities of his units. Other warriors have active abilities that can change the tide of a battle. For example, Jean d’Arc can create a protective bubble around an area which protects friendly units from ranged unit fire. The rulers give strong buffs on the player’s settlements which can range from worker buffs to Acamapichtili’s ability to instantly finish buildings.

One of the major disappointments of this game is that it lacks any long term singleplayer content. Skirmishes are included and the AI is decent. A survival mode is included where the player has to defeat increasingly difficult waves of enemies. Finally, challenges are short and frustrating distractions that often rely on using concepts such as kiting to complete them. There is unfortunately no campaign available for this game at the time of writing which is a huge waste of potential. One of the most memorable parts of games such as Age of Empires, Empire Earth, etc. is their enjoyable campaigns. 

Overall, this is an enjoyable RTS with a large focus on the competitive multiplayer scene. Matches are fast paced and the variety of races make every match-up feel fresh. Without a good campaign, Empires Apart can’t be one of the greats of the RTS genre.

[u]Sound:[/u]
Sound design is quite good. Each race has its own voice lines for each unit. Each unit has only a few voice lines and every time the player right clicks it plays one. I would have preferred a short delay before the next line is played. The ambience is quite nice and so is the music. The music is also unique for each race which improves the uniqueness of each race. The songs are rallying and war like, even the title screen music. 

 [u]Graphics:[/u]
The graphics are an abstract polygonal style that works quite well with this game. Even though they are a bit abstract, units are unique and can be easily distinguished in a large scale battle. The same goes for heroes. Buildings fall apart in chunks which are acted upon by physics and makes destroying enemy buildings all the more satisfying. 
 
[u]Performance:[/u]
The netcode for this game is astonishingly good. I have played against another player in Germany while I’m on the US east coast, and there wasn’t any noticeable lag at all. This is great considering players who pick up this game will be spending most of their time in multiplayer.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[u]Pros:[/u]
Unique Races
Solid RTS Gameplay
Great Netcode
Fast Matches

[u]Cons:[/u]
Lack of Meaningful Singleplayer Content
High Price for Amount of Content

[u]Rating[/u]
[b]7/10[/b].

If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198107996703', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13966, 'last_played': 1544802921}
review:
Need to write a new review now that this game was made free to play. Here's the old review when the game was first released:

Short version.
I like the game. Can recommend.

Long version:
I come from AoE2 background (around 600h playtime). I can't compare this to other RTS like StarCraft 2 but I can give an AoE2 player's perspective on this. I have played around 120h in the Empires Apart's beta.

If you have played AoE 2 you can pick up the basics fast. This game isn't a simple AoE2 clone. The game has its own feel to it and differentiates from AoE2 in many aspects. Generally the game is faster paced than AoE2 and has new mechanics and quality of life improvements.

Currently there are 6 civilizations. Every one of them is unique. For example, Mongols play completely different to the Byzantines. Each civ has some mechanics that are unique to that civ. Balancing this will be difficult but the devs are listening to the community and are ready to support the game.

There isn't a full campaign at least yet but there are puzzle-like challenges for each civ. They are great at showing the unique abilities that civs have. When you have grasped the basics of the game these are a good way to learn about unique things the civs have and some more advanced tactics.

Currently there is no scenario editor but I've heard that modding tools are going to be released sometime after the release. I'd still need a dev confirmation (maybe there's a response in the comments?) to be sure.

The game is not perfect. It currently has some bugs and balancing issues. Thankfully the devs are active and want to make this game as good as possible. They listen to the feedback and want to make the experience even better than it currently is.

I'm looking forward to seeing how this game evolves and genuinely enjoy playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056687846', 'num_games_owned': 942, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1588440455}
review:
Although I love the concept of the game, I love the RTS genre and I love the graphics of the game... There are so many bugs that the game should not have been released as a complete game. If it was an alpha I'd understand the bugs but man the bugs are too many.

[b]- The framerate drops at a certain point in the game are unbearable. Seriously I have 2 GTX 1080s and they cannot handle this (obviously it's a bug within the game). I get 4-9 FPS in a SINGLE player game. This is advertised as MULTI player game... imagine playing a 4v4 with 6 FPS... Yeah, thought so too.

- The A.I. is pre-historic here. They do not even bother to attack me no matter the difficulty. I mean on the hardest, yes they do attack a lot more, but on normal difficulty, they come to me and just keep patrolling around, and not attacking. They only attack once I attack the units that are meant to be attacking me. Also when I build walls and block one of the ways they come, they don't try to walk around where there are no walls, they just stand there and die from the towers... Even games from the 2000s did better with A.I.

- There are so many other bugs - at first I had a problem starting the game up (that was due to Avast being a di** I suppose), then obviously the framerate... then moving to not being able to load up my saves. 

- I wish there was a campgain in this game as well, pretty much every RTS game does...[/b]

Overall, this is a very well done game, beautiful and just quite polished (in terms of gameplay and graphics), however the bugs are what just make this game unplayable, quite literally. I think with a patch or two and all of the bugs being fixed it would actually be a very good game. So yes, I would recommend to those that love the classics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153240435', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1565006710}
review: I honestly don't know what to say. I am really dissapointed. I am a casual player that plays especially singleplayer, but this clearly a multiplayer game. The A.I. is extremely dumb. There is no campaign, but some really lazy "challanges". There is no editor to make our own scenarios. The singleplayer experience is non-existent. If you are for the singleplayer, this might not be the game for you. However, the graphics are really beautiful and the game runs well. The factions are truly unique and fun to play. I haven't tried the multiplayer, but I assume that it is really good. The game is really multiplayer-focused, which I guess that it's good for the community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1522350144}
review:
What a massive, massive let down this game is.
Being a huge fan of the classic RTS games for many a year, I had watched the development of this game over the last 6 or so months with interest, hoping it would pick up where the likes of AOE left off, perhaps with a modern take on the tried and trusted formats, no such luck.
Well, unless by modern, you expect the increasingly cynical approach game developers are taking these days, by releasing half finished, poorly optimised content, with the promise of further updates to provide the content that should be there at launch, this game would appear to excel in that respect.
I requested a refund after around 1 hour of play time. Having purchased around 200 games on Steam, this is only the 2nd time I've done so, here's why.
I was immediately struck by the realisation that this is nowhere near a full/finished game.
Having played through the worryingly short tutorial, and in the apparent absence of any kind of single player campaign option (really and RTS without a campaign!?) I decided I'd start off with the survival mode. 
I was astonished to find that this mode contained 1 map .... with the promise of more maps to be added later, apparently.
The map itself was beyond basic, a barren square with a few resources dotted around, and a town centre in the middle as a starting point. The idea of course, being to defend it against increasingly difficult waves of enemies, something I became bored of long before the end of the 15 minutes it took the AI to overwhelm my increasingly half hearted attempts at defence.
I decided next, to give the challenge scenarios a bash, hoping that it would form the basis of some kind of campaign to play through, no such luck, just very basic scenarios of units squaring off against one another ... 2 archers vs a more powerful infantry unit, etc,etc ... again I became very bored, very quickly and gave up after a few of these challenges.
So then, nothing else for it, with little interest in playing multiplayer, at least until I'd managed to get a few practice games under my belt, I gave the skirmish a go.
Again, an absolute dearth of options here. The basic, choose AI opponent, choose difficulty, and if you like, set teams, and with only 7 maps, little scope for variety.
Having set up a skirmish against 2 AI opponents on a large island map, I clicked on start ... and the game promplty crashed, kicking me back out to desktop.
Another failed attmpt at launching a skirmish, was more than enough to put my already rapidly waning interest in this game to bed.
Perhaps someone with a little more perseverance, would have messed around with their settings enough to get the skirmish mode working, however having already tired of this mess of a game, I seen little point in wasting more of my time trying to get this poorly optimized, half hearted, half finished game, to run.
Becoming increasingly sick of being conned out of my money by developers who can't be bothered to finish their games before releasing them, I decided I wanted a refund, and I also decided to take the time to write this review (again something I very rarely do) in the hope that it would save someone else the disappointment of playing this game.
Do yourself a favour, go back to AOE, dust of your copy of C&C, or content yourself with another go around on Sins of a Solar Empire, in the hope that at some point, someone, somewhere, will do this classic genre some justice again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044754679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1522352688}
review:
Yes, I am giving a thumbs down after playing this game for less than an hour. I think the game is relatively fun, but it feels like a blatant copypasta of Age of Empires II. This isn't really a bad thing, but I'm not ready to throw $30 (at full price) for this game when I can go play the original. 

I think the developers did a decent job with it, but I'm just not sold on it so I asked for a refund. It just feels way too similar despite a couple differences. I'd love to revisit it should it go on a deeper sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005974950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6357, 'last_played': 1575374475}
review:
The best RTS game in a LONG time. 

There are problems obviously, with balance and a few bugs, but they will be fixed in time and over all the multiplayer experiance is super enjoyable and pretty smooth.

Considering that this is a game made by 3 develoupers for the most part I believe it is an incredible success! Some AI behvaiours and a few odd decisions aside the game is super complex and really enjoyable. 

Pro tip tho, turn motion blur off, many people have been saying that scrolling is laggy and it's a misconception due to motion blur so turn it off and you'll have no problems! 

GLHF!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029802694', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2864, 'last_played': 1574801787}
review:
Seguo Empires Apart da tempo ed ho avuto anche il piacere di essere scelto per la beta.

Progetto italiano molto ambizioso che sta rispettando ciò che mi aspettavo e per questo non posso che consigliarlo.

Al prezzo di un indie (essendo uno di essi), potrete divertirvi con un RTS old-school che mischia diversi concetti in un unico gioco.

Se vi piace Age of Empires, Age of Mithology o Warcraft, questo gioco farà per voi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076870284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12235, 'last_played': 1628346370}
review:
Empires Apart review from a multilayer rts player.

First of all I want to say I have been close to the developer process since the alpha and have seen and amazing progress. The developers have showed great work ethic and have been really upfront with the testers. If you don't want to read the full review the tl;dr is game is still not perfect but is made by great and passionate people and based on my 2 year involvement in the game I am sure they will continue improving Empires Apart and iron the small flaws it has. In my current personal ranking Empires Apart is the most fun rts on the market and 2nd best all around after Starcraft 2.

Game play: The game has six unique civilization with completely different playstyles. The balance is still not there but the multilayer is still extremely fun and I know people with 1000 hours just in the beta playing multilayer vs the AI or the same opponent just because they got addicted to the game. 

Features: The multilayer rts players will be extremely pleased to hear that the game has really good pathfinding and all the important features a modern rts game should have I,  including unit grid, shift queue, control click, ranked system with mmr,  leaderboards and many more. There are still some issues but I am sure the game will get improved along the way knowing the passion the developers have for this game.

Community: The people I met in the alpha/beta are probably the best community I have been part of. Furthermore the game has attracted a lot of high level and pro players from other rts games which has made even the early testing phase of the game really competitive.

Important to note is that some stuff like replays didn't make it to the release version of the game but the development of a indie game with limited resources and tiny team has to face the dead line at some point and I have been assured that replays and many other features are coming ! All those are more quality of life improvements and there is nothing missing from the game that can stop you from having either casual fun or play high level matches against great players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099363366', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1522348837}
review:
完全就是换了个画风的帝国时代（从建筑风格到单位的语音仍然有一股浓郁的帝国气息）。
挂羊头卖狗肉好歹也要有点自己的东西，但是这个游戏根本看不见自己的东西，与其玩这个缩水版帝国不如直接去玩帝国。
最最最重要的是，游戏掉帧严重，屏幕不移动的时候一百多帧，动起来瞬间变十几帧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198134451129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10083, 'last_played': 1576793024}
review:
This game is missing a few quality of life features and possibly needs some balancing, but I am sure these will be fixed in the near future and it is otherwise a solid game. Definitely headed more in the right direction than many other RTS games of the recent past.

Would recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988918545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1679514106}
review:
Ich finde das Spiel Cool :)

Es ist anders als das Originale Age of Empires. 

Aufgefallene änderungen z.B mehrere Civiliationen die unterschiedliche möglichkeiten haben. Wie z.B Nomaden Da gibt es wie bei den Wikingern (Age of Mytholgoy) Einheiten die Bauen können und Siedler.

Oder anstatt im Dorfentrum ins nächste Zeitalter zu steigen gibt es Wirtschaftliche oder Militärische  Weiterentwicklung. Die man im Obern mittleren Bildschirmrand anklicken kann. 

Wirtschaftlich = > Weiterentwicklungen für Wirtschaft
Militärisch => Neue Soldaten + Militärische upgrades usw...

Ich finde im großen und ganzen das Spiel gut gelungen. Ich werde es weiterhin spielen :-) 
Die grafik ist bissl gewöhnungsbedürftig aber sonst sehr gut.

Was ich Negativ finde. Es gibt irgendwie kaum Spieler in der Lobby :(. Kaum Games offen bei Release vielleicht ändert sich das noch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057016930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3679, 'last_played': 1554042397}
review: Very exciting new RTS game, I played in the beta and it was great! Highly reccommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037149488', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1539723001}
review:
Empezaré por partes, esto es lo que todos los fans de el age of empires 2 andaban buscando, un juego muy bien hecho pero además con el puntazo de que hace un gran honor al AOE 2 sin ser un clon.

Tenemos 6 civilizaciones divididas en subgrupos por así decirlo de la siguiente manera:
Bizantinos y Franceses---> Expansión.
Chinos y Árabes--->Protección.
Aztecas y Mongoles--->Agresión.

Cada civilización tiene una forma distinta de juego basada en su estilo, expansión, protección y agresión.. siendo como bien se deduce mas agresivas o mas defensivas en plan tanke.

Las diferencias entre la forma de jugar es tal que por ejemplo los mongoles (civilización nómada), sus unidades son las que se convierten en los edificios estilo zergs del starcraft con la peculiaridad de que puedes recuperar al aldeano si desmontas la construcción.

De verdad que se agradece esto, es decir.. no tenemos 15 civilizaciones o más practicamente iguales entre ellas, si no que tenemos 6 diferenciadas en subgrupos y con un estilo de juego muy diferente entre ellas.

En cuanto a la configuración del teclado es otra maravilla, tenemos la capacidad de crearnos el perfil para cada civilización y elegir nuestras macros (accesos directos con las teclas), etc.
Cabe destacar que antes de empezar una partida con la civilización podemos elegir un heroe entre 2 que nos da a elegir con ciertas habilidades únicas.

Otra cosa distinta al age of empires es que aquí no se avanza de edad si no que tenemos dos ramas en las que ir avanzando, o avanzamos en ecónomía (mejorando así los aldeanos, edificios ecónomicos etc), o avanzamos en técnología militar en la que mejoramos directamente las unidades militares a costa de una economía peor pero con una capacidad ofensiva mayor, todo depende de la civilización y el estilo de juego que escojamos.

Podemos avanzar por ejemplo primero en economía y a continuación avanzar en militar, el comienzo es simple ya que no se nos mezclan los recursos, para avanzar en economía son por ejemplo 400 de madera, y en militar 400 de comida, pero deberemos elegir en que avanzar primero.

Por cada vez que avancemos en economía por ejemplo podremos crear un centro urbano adicional.

Luego otra de las diferencias que hay es en las reliquias y en los monjes, una función muy similar al age of empires pero también con diferencia bastante grande entre ellos, por ejemplo... Los monjes chinos tienen un daño bastante interesante dando mamporros a lo más típico shaolín eso sí no pueden transformar a las unidades enemigas, y si los dejas quietos pasados unos segundos entrarán en posición de meditación y curarán automáticamente a las unidades de alrededor dentro de un area.

Hay una estratégia un tanto curiosa de los chinos, y es que no tienen mejoras para recoger más rapidamente la madera, o el oro como otras civilizaciones pero tienen una opción que podemos activar o desactivar a nuestro antojo en la que recogen los recursos más rápidamente a costa de que el aldeano va perdiendo vida progresivamente hasta llegar al punto de morir, si en lugar de ello ponemos cerca algún monje que cura en area y los posicionamos de forma que los aldeanos estén dentro de su area de sanación podremos combar las dos cosas.

Recogerán recursos más rápidamente y no morirá ningún aldeano, curiosa forma de llenarte la ciudad de monjes.

Las reliquias pueden ser transportadas al templo, igual que en el age of empires 1 y 2 pero... dan unas ventajas muy buenas en la partida haciendo muy interesante su recogida, por no decir que casi obligatoria.

Conforme vamos reuniendo reliquias recibiremos distintas bonificaciones para la civilización, obteniendo al reuniras + 1 de ataque + 1 de defensa para TODAS las unidades, +1 de oro por segundo, +1 de alcance para las unidades a distancia, y así... contra más reliquias obtengamos mejores bonificaciones obtendremos para la civilización.

Por decir algo que para mi no es negativo pero que para algunas personas puede que lo sea,  [b] no tiene modo campaña, está completamente enfocado al multijugador, la IA deja mucho que desear en las partidas también  tiene un modo de juego llamado supervivencia en el que recoges recursos durante el día y por la noche te atacan, debes sobrevivir el máximo tiempo posible.

Para los amantes de los RTS que busquen partidas multijugador, clasificatorias etc y un sucesor más que digno para el AOE 2, este es tu juego, [B]  si por el contrario buscas una campaña y demás, no lo compres porque no tiene.  [/b]

La banda sonora es de lo mejorcito, tenemos cantidad de mapas diferentes en las que se va alternando día y noche conforme jugamos un detalle más añadido.

[b]
[h1]
[u]
Pros:
[/u]

-Civilizaciones muy diferenciadas entre sí.

-Interfaz muy intuitiva y fluida.

-Gran capacidad para macrear las teclas de forma comoda y diferente para cada civilización con la creación sencilla de perfiles para el teclado.

-Muy enfocado a multijugador, está en pre-season con lo cual hay clasificaciones según el nivel que tengamos, lo típico, oro, plata, platino etc...

-Muy buena banda sonora, cada civilización tiene su propia música.

-Ciclo de día y noche, el rango de visibilidad por la noche se verá bastante reducida, (ciertas unidades tienen ventajas únicas de noche, como los asesinos) un punto que a simple vista parece simple pero que es bastante importante.
[u]
Contras:
[/u]

-No tiene campaña (es una lástima ya que con los heroes habría quedado muy bien un modo historia, ojalá la implementen más adelante.)

-Tiene algunos pequeños bugs en el path finding al clickar y que las unidades tomen un camino erroneo o equivocado para llegar, (no he tenido casos graves ni desastrosos, ni me ha pasado frecuentemente como en el age of empires definitive edition, pero si me ha pasado alguna vez, nada grave y que supongo que solventaran en próximos parches.)

-En ocasiones se cierra el juego al terminar la partida, es un error un poco molesto que supongo que arreglarán en algún hotfix.

-La IA tiene unos errores bastante gordos que deberían de arreglar cuanto antes, muy poca dificultad y movimientos sin sentido en las partidas.

[/h1]

[B]  En mi opinión personal basandome siempre en el aspecto multijugador, es un juego muy bueno 9 de 10.

[/B]
[/B]
[/B]

Tened en cuenta que mi valoración es  siempre enfocándola en el apartado multijugador que es lo que más me interesa, he pasado por alto los notables bugs de la IA y la falta de campaña, aspectos basados en el modo un jugador.  

No he tenido lag en ninguna partida, ni problemas de desconexión, de momento.
Repito, conforme está el juego ahora si tu intención es jugar vs la ia en partidas de un jugador, no lo compres porque te defraudaras.

Si por el contrario te interesa jugar en multijugador competitivo con clasificaciones y demás y te gustan los RTS puede ser una compra muy interesante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068261286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1522356471}
review:
Things to think about when getting this game. 

1. You will have never ending resnycs with playing a 2 vs 2, 2 human players vs 2 AI.
2. Mulitplayer is strickly pvp at this point.
3. Surivial is solo only just want to confirm that.


I would not recommend this game to anyone in this current stage infact we are getting our money back until the game is futher worked on and improved more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045317979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1525970701}
review:
Im Prinzip ein AoE 2 abklatsch im niedlichen Grafikstil.
Es ist gut gemacht und beinhaltet alles was ein RTS braucht.

Es müsste aber noch so einiges behoben werden:
- die Übersetzung ist nicht einwandfrei bzw. teilweise noch Englisch
- die Dorfbewohner legen manchmal Felder nicht neu an, stecken irgendwo fest oder laufen auf der Stelle (ebenso manchmal auch Soldaten) und das obwohl man sehr viele davon braucht....
- ES GIBT KEINE KAMPANGE! nur ein paar Herausforderungen
- die Reichweite des Trebuchet ist ja lachhaft
- Pro Wirtschaftszweig (Militär/Wirtschaft) gibt es nur 2 Entwicklungen?

author: {'steamid': '76561198374682041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1524495024}
review: badly designed gameplay, barely any content, lots of technical issues, worst AI ive ever seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076395663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1523745199}
review:
Great game if you're into AoE2, PVP especially, but also if you're into RTS games in general. However it's not "basically Age of Empires". The basic eco at the start is the same (luring boars etc.) but afterwards the differences really show.

What I like especially is how different the civs are. It's not just differently skinned units, some unique units, some bonuses and some locked techs; the civs are REALLY different. 

Game isn't that expensive so give it a try maybe, would be sad to see another great RTS die of a lack of players. There are problems but I rather give it a try and hope the issues get fixed than miss out on this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023721255', 'num_games_owned': 1960, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1522369432}
review:
Oduncu, yaparım, tamam…

Bu üç kelimeyi okuyunca kafasında şimşekler çakanları şöyle alalım. Evet size sesleniyorum “Age of”çular. Niye mi sizlere sesleniyorum, çünkü elimizde Age of’çunun derdine deva, “aranılan kan” denilebilecek bir gerçek zamanlı strateji oyunu var. Hatta ve hatta en temel mekanikler olarak elimizdeki oyun Age of Empires II ile neredeyse birebir aynı, lakin öbür cihetlerde daha yeni ve daha yenilikçi.

İncelememizin devamı için sizleri şuraya alalım : http://www.oyunfest.com/empires-apart-inceleme.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198163202932', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1541096890}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116201086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1523053122}
review:
I don't get why so many people are downvoting this game after 1 or 2 hours playing it.
This is an RTS man! Wait AT LEAST 10 hours of game, then write the review...
I followed all the development of this game, since 2016. I couldn't wait to play it and I'm not disappointed at all. This game is just so cool and the meta with 6 very different civs feels great. Give it a chance, a real one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002164043', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1563197196}
review:
A formula we all know and love, collect resources, build a town, build an army and attack, however empires apart has its own identity with some smart game mechanics such as hero units, night and day cycle, and very different unique factions, the factions are so individual with unique buildings, tech trees and units. 

The only thing missing is a good single player campaign mode, it does have ai skirmish options, but as of this review the ai does need a little extra work. The devs are aware of both problems and have promised free updates and dlc support for the foreseeable future. 

If you like RTS games this is a must buy

author: {'steamid': '76561197966440133', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1548002852}
review:
I've been following this game for more then a year now and it is finally released! The dev team is great and really listens to the community feedback. Granted it is only a small team, it is quite remarkable what they've accomplished so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281549731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1535124034}
review:
游戏好评，不过由于游戏是刚刚推出，还有很多应该改进的地方，如果不是对rts游戏，和历史军事感兴趣的玩家建议等游戏逐步完善后再入手。
下面说几个应该改进的地方：

author: {'steamid': '76561198180958101', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2254, 'last_played': 1544347574}
review:
这是一部war3,sc2,aoe2的混血后代，游戏内核相当好，LOW POLY画面精致，
但是缺陷也相当多，联机时主机永远占有延迟优势，平衡尚未达到成熟，

总结：是一部非常值得期待的RTS，
如果你想关注潜力股，请入；如果你要的是成熟的游戏，请别入。

开发者团队只有三人，我在discord,twitch看着他们一边加班一边回答玩家的问题，
我就决定入了。

PS:今天4月2日，一天打了三个更新。

author: {'steamid': '76561198060640659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1602084757}
review:
Ну что я могу сказать, игра мне понравилась. Опытные игроки не увидят в этой игре что-то кардинально новое, игра сделана по класической формуле Age of Empires. Графика приятная на взгляд, глаза не устают, так же присутствует смена дня и ночи. Есть небольшие приятные мелочи, например у воинов ацтеков есть возможность активировать навык "взять в плен", тем самым ваш боец не убьёт врага, когда у него не останется здоровья, а возьмёт его в плен, рядом появится пленник, которого можно обратить в рабочего или отправить его на алтарь, чтобы улучшить экономические или военные технологии. Так же у ацтеков нельзя улучшать воинов (ранги), воины сами повышаются в ранге, нанеся определённое количество урона врагам.
  Правда есть и недостаток, у всех фракций достаточно мало технологий, по этой причине вы можете уйти в экономику, быстро прокачать все технологии, а потом беспрерывно клипать солдат и давить так врага. Хотелось бы видеть больше технологий для изучения. И что не мало важно, в городских центрах нет кнопки, "тревога", что затрудняет спрятать рабочих при нападении, приходиться делать всё в ручную. Так же в игре на данный момент всего 6 наций и отличаются они от друг друга не так сильно, скажем так, у каждой нации есть стандартный "мечникк" и "копейщик". Однако можно похвалить разработчиков за то, что тип этих воинов одинаковый, но они имеют свою текстуру (подстать их культуре) и историческое название.
  Контента не так много, я надеюсь это в будущем исправят. Но так же есть разные режимы: класический(битва), испытание(мини-миссии), выживание(продержаться в обороне как можно больше), ну и обучение. Кампании в игре нет =(
Иногда игра может крашнуться, к счастью в игре есть автосохранение.
  Игру рекомендую, главное чтобы её развивали.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017450503', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1556384321}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002039805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1504227322}
review:
Empires Apart succeeds as a small, tightly-designed and multiplayer-focused successor to traditional RTS games like AoE2. Playing this really hits the nostalgia feels - the initial moments of gameplay feel very similar to AoE 2, with a Town Center, villagers who can gather resources, and a single scout to start exploring the map. However, once you start creating more buildings and researching new technologies, the game opens out to be something quite unique. Each civilisation has their own buildings, units, technology tree and special abilities that differentiate them far more than other games.  The way that Byzantines play compared to the Aztecs or Mongols is pronounced, and it stops the game from becoming too repetitive where you just play the same tactics over and over. The addition of one-off "Hero" units with special abilities adds some interesting variation into the game as well, forcing you to learn to micro your units instead of just sending your entire army into battle and leaving them to it. Players of traditional RTS games will probably enjoy the way that you can play skirmish against the A.I and just base build, hop into a multiplayer lobby to play with randoms or friends, or join the Ranked Duel queue for more intense matches against other players.

There are a couple of absent features, such as a campaign or map editor, which is unfortunate but understandable given that this is an indie game from a small team. On the plus side, the devs have confirmed that modding tools will be coming later, and depending on the success of the game maybe even a campaign will be added. In terms of how it plays, there are some oddities and bugs - unit pathing is usually fine but occasionally bugs out, and if you play against someone with a dodgy internet connection then rejoining the game can be a little hit or miss - but for the most part, it's a pretty stable game.

Overall I really like it. It's a more modern, interesting take on the same principles that make AoE great. So long as you can accept that it's more focused around multiplayer or A.I skirmish modes, I would say that it is well worth getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061661794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1522381764}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988636447', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1540600752}
review:
Ah, finally an RTS in the style of AoE or Rise of Nations again.

And the (few) civilizations that are in the game are different enough. 

There are still some bugs (e.g. one of my riders in the Byzantine faction was goofing around when it stood between 2 buildings) and the AI isn't the best yet (was building houses in my city when I nearly destroyed it). Don't get me wrong, the AI isn't terrible, but it needs some fixing (same goes for the animal AI).

But I really love the graphics, as they are rather unique - especially for an RTS. Oh and the music is quite good, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999613929', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1524149341}
review:
Empires apart is a step into the well remembered shoes of age of empires and RTS of old, with a modern experience aimed at multiplayer gameplay.

Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AYN5bbVhrBI

Text:
This is not a perfect RTS, but its pretty damn solid if you like competitive or multiplayer gameplay. the races available are diverse enough to provide tactical choice and options, while remaining coherent enough that even when you don't know every nuance you are not completely lost.

A solid chain of units, upgrades, tech advancements and tactical choices allows for diverse gameplay across the board... If you like multiplayer.

Because while the game does offer a skirmish mode (and a horde survival mode, which is fun) the AI is damned weak and provides little challenge, but the online ranked and unranked multiplayer does give the game tons of strength.

Visually the game is not a powerhouse, but the polygonal shapes of the graphics are mostly distinct and clear and while some unit details are lost in the shuffle of fighting, overall i have no complaints on the artstyle or visual fidelity.

Where i do have an issue with is the Unit AI - With pathing in particular causing me quite a few headaches when units cant decide if left or right is faster, and start spinning around in circles. Very annoying, causing unnecessary micromanagement.

Having said that, audio is also pretty solid in the title, with voice overs, music and sound queues all pretty solid.

all in all, a pretty damn enjoyable and solid multiplayer RTS experience with lots of depth and tons of fun units to play with.

If you enjoy the review [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11617580/]do follow my curator feed![/url] Or check out the various other reviews on [url=https://youtube.com/c/guylogicgaming] YouTube[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198202098269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1522466024}
review:
[h1]《帝国》和《魔兽》之间的一个新的平衡点 —— 《帝国分裂 Empires Apart》[/h1]

[u]首先感谢奶牛关野蔷薇计划的key，我非常兴奋能有机会评测这部最新RTS佳作《帝国分裂》。[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/Empires_Apart/review/]原图文评测地址[/url] [/u]

[u]本评测基于Beta测试版本。[/u]

[b]前言[/b]

作为一个RTS爱好者，你是否曾经想过，把《帝国时代》中的富有历史性、真实性的战争元素和《魔兽争霸》中不同种族独特的玩法相结合，从而在体验历史般的战争场面的同时，又能有许多的可操作性和趣味性。如果你曾经这样幻想过，那么恭喜你，现在有这样的一款游戏制作出来并且马上就可以玩到，它就是《帝国分裂》。

[b]《帝国时代》的影子[/b]

不得不说，当我第一次开始游戏教程的时候，我的心情是既激动又失望的。令我激动的是这一切的一切都那么的熟悉，从房屋、农田、兵营、射箭场这些建筑类别到食物、木材、黄金、石头四种资源，不光是兵种的能力及其资源消耗，甚至连配音都让我感觉仿佛是在玩当年“伐伐伐木工“的《帝国时代2》。但是同时我又有些失望，难道这部作品完全”抄袭“了《帝国》，仅仅是将其变成了3D Low Poly版本吗？当然，之后的游玩和探索过程中，我得到了否定的答案，不过这款游戏确确实实有着非常浓重的《帝国时代》的影子。

事实上，本作在各个方面都和帝国时代非常相似或者说故意保持一致。简单举几个例子。

首先是资源，四种资源都与《帝国2》中相同，并且数量级上也一致，甚至连单位的资源消耗都一致。从小就玩帝国时代的我对兵种的资源需求几乎都倒背如流，比如射箭场的第二兵种掷矛兵消耗食物35，木材25都完全一样。

其次是建筑，农舍、港口、市场、寺庙等基础设施样样俱全，除此之外军事基地也基本上是步兵营、射箭场和马厩三类。城墙、箭塔、火炮塔也没落下。不仅如此，多数建筑的外貌都和《帝国2》中非常一致。

除去这些之外，整个游戏的基础系统都仿佛完全照搬《帝国》。科技树、单位排兵布阵、空闲村民、遗迹无不勾起了我的怀旧之心。

这一切的一切，起初让我认为是抄袭，在经过一段时间的深入体验后，我会觉得这是开发者深思熟虑后的有意为之。

[b]民族的特色玩法是它与《帝国》最大的不同[/b]

最开始的教程里，我所玩到的国家是拜占庭人，很巧的是，这个国家的玩法可能是所有国家中，最像原始《帝国2》中的玩法的国家。如我之前所说的那样，在操作这个国家时，给我的体验就是在玩low poly版的帝国时代。

而当我再试中国、蒙古、阿兹特克等国家后，我才慢慢开始真正了解这个游戏。试问作为一名RTS玩家，你是否尝试过不消耗资源就能建建筑，建筑还能随时拆了跑路再随时建？很不可想象把，《帝国分裂》中的蒙古国就是这样的存在。开发者们应该是参考蒙古的游牧民族的特色，开发了这样一种玩法。城镇大厅可以生产两种单位，村民只能采集资源，而开拓者可以不消耗资源就建造建筑。同时任何建筑都可随时再拆解成多个开拓者，无论它们跑到哪里都可以立即再重组成之前的建筑或是其他建筑。

这样大胆的设想和玩法我是从来没有见过，我所玩过的RTS游戏比如《魔兽》、《Northgard》甚至《Tooth and Tail》等多是建造固定的基地类型（哪怕暗夜精灵中的也只有几种树人可以移动并且不能随意拆解），可见开发者们的脑洞之大。这样的玩法不仅丰富了可玩性，也还原了各个国家的文化特色，更加有代入感和区分感。

当然类似的特色玩法还有许多。比如中国人的监工，开启后增加资源采集速度但是村民会收到伤害（虽然被黑了一把但是有点意思呢）。阿兹特克的兵种可以通过战斗升级，可以抓俘虏来献祭，并且献祭后能够升级科技。

兵种的特点也非常鲜明，不仅仅两个国家之间完全没有雷同单位，还有许多特别的兵种和进攻方式。中国人擅长布陷阱，阿兹特克有暗杀单位，平时处于隐身状态，可以一击必杀一个单位，妥妥的RTS版刺客信条啊。。。

还有很多很多不同我还没来得及发掘，但是已经可以看出这部作品的玩法之丰富，可以预料到之后会有很多骚操作和战术被玩家所发掘。

[b]轻量级[/b]

现如今RTS都走上了轻量级的道路，《Tooth and Tail》就是个非常好的成功的例子，而本作也不例外。比如这款游戏取消了伐木场、农场和矿场之分，直接将仓库来替代。取消了一些有的没的无关紧要的科技，使得资源基本就用来发展军事和经济。其次无论出兵速度还是造建筑速度均快于《帝国》，一场1V1对战，大致半小时之内就能分出胜负。

[b]其他特色[/b]

本作还有些值得注意的部分，例如它加入了白天黑夜，在黑夜中视野将会变小，且生存模式中敌人只有在黑夜才会来袭。另外每个国家还有英雄可以在游戏开局时选择，英雄和兵种的有机搭配能产生多种不同的打法，都非常值得玩家去探索。

[b]Bug与不足[/b]

以下是beta测试中遇到的bug，可能已经修复。

-	教程名称与实际图标名称不对应：Temple - 寺庙/Eglise， 算是翻译没到位的问题。

-	设置的下拉菜单默认值不显示，每次默认地方都显示为空，并且选择中文之后，再次打开依然为英文。

不足


-	某些字体太小，如教程时画面右边的文字。

-	优化还有待加强，目前游玩过程中偶尔会有些许卡顿。

-	挑战部分。缺少描述，场景简陋，千篇一律。

[b]总结[/b]

我曾经从小学开始玩了将近十年的帝国时代，这款作品对我来说算是久违的帝国like的RTS新作，它在帝国和魔兽之间找到了一个很好的平衡点，除此之外它的美术和画面也相当不错，我相信也希望他能成为帝国爱好者的新宠。

author: {'steamid': '76561197968054795', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1522349213}
review:
[h1]Review[/h1]
[i] Este analisis es de la versión en fase de Beta, más unas horas probando la [b]versión final[/b]. Cuando probemos bien el multiplayer se actualizará esta review, aún más si cabe.[/i] 

Para ser sincero Empires Apart no es un juego a la altura de los tiempos que corren. Entiendo perfectamente que son apuestas de estudios pequeños sin un alto presupuesto, pero desde mi humilde opinión y sin campaña NO lo recomendaría.

Review completa en [url=https://www.mmoingame.com/2018/03/03/analisis-empires-apart/] MMOinGame[/url]

Hemos estado probando el juego en su versión final y el rendimiento ha empeorado. Si bien la IA parece tener mejoras que hacen tener un rival bastante mejor y las unidades ya no se quedan sin hacer nada, se vuelve muy tedioso jugar una partida con el rendimiento bastante resentido que presenta el título, haciendo que todo vaya bastante lento.

[i]La recien lanzada actualización 1.02 ha solucionado los problemas con el rendimiento.[/i]

[list]
    [*]Se ha lanzado sin campaña.
[/list]

Siguen los problemas cuando acabas con un rival crasheando el juego. Adjunto [url=https://i.imgur.com/Iah7v21.png]Captura.[/url]

Equipo donde se ha probado el juego por si alguno piensa que usamos una cafetera:
[list]
[*]CPU: Intel i7-5820k 3.3Ghz
[*]Placa: Asrock X99 Extreme4
[*]RAM: G.Skill Ripjaws 4 Blue DDR4 3000 PC4-24000 16GB 4x4GB CL15
[*]GPU: nVIDIA GeForce GTX 980 Gaming G1 WindForce OC 4GB GDDR5
[*]Discos Duros: Samsung 960 EVO NVMe M.2 SSD PCI-e 250GB
[/list]

Nota: 6
[b]Lo Bueno[/b]
[list]
[*]Facciones diferenciadas
[*]Explota y mejora las virtudes del clásico Age of Empires
[*]Música decente
[/list]
[b]Lo Malo[/b]
[*]Gráficos Low Cost
[*]IA mejorable
[*]No cuenta con campaña
[*]El modo Desafió es meramente relleno, un "tutorrial avanzado"
[*]Practicamente sin jugadores en el multiplayer
developer_response:
Zfreny sorry you didn't enjoy the game. You are a journalist and only ever had access to a beta preview build. This is not the version that players are on now. 

Journalists are not expected to use their beta versions to write reviews on Steam! Steam reviews are supposed to be by other players on the released version, not journalists on a beta. 

Thanks for reconsidering!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966913375', 'num_games_owned': 1010, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1562770057}
review:
The game features a skirmish mode either online or against the AI, annoyingly unbalanced challenge scenarios (one or two friendly units against several enemies), a survival mode, and a brief tutorial. There is no campaign mode of scripted missions, though the randomized maps for the skirmish mode do give a lot of replay value. The six factions in the game are pleasingly varied. The interface has many shortcomings: resource locations need bigger indicators on the minimap, there is no “select all military units” button, there is no “select only military units” option while box-selecting, and there are no repeating or infinite queues. All of these issues become magnified with the fast pace of the game; the inefficient interface really hinders your ability to play without getting continually frustrated. Finite resources (food, wood, stone, and gold) mean migration is necessary in longer games. Efficient resource collection (by placing nearby storage structures) and continually increasing the population cap by constructing houses allow for quick upgrades to higher technology levels. Military units each have a specific counter, and while formations and stances are available, combat usually just devolves into a giant mass of units chasing a single enemy around the map. The AI can be a challenge as it is good at collecting resources and producing new villagers, but it usually sends only a few units at a time instead of a concentrated offensive. Empires Apart is a solid real-time strategy game with fast-paced gameplay and varied factions, but it lacks the smooth, feature-filled interface required for true excellence.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bmDc-qjb7Gg
